The Canon EOS R100 Mirrorless Camera is a powerful imaging tool that allows you to easily and precisely shoot spectacular images and movies. Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology with 143 AF zones allows for fast and accurate autofocus across the frame, resulting in crisp and clean photos even in demanding shooting settings. The EOS R100 camera's 6.5 fps electronic shutter allows you to easily shoot fast-moving subjects, while the 2.36m-Dot OLED EVF and 3" 1.04m-Dot LCD screen give crisp and immersive viewing options. With built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connection, as well as an SD card port, you can wirelessly transfer and share your photographs, making it easy to remain connected and share your creativity with the world. With the RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM lens, this EOS R100 camera provides versatility and performance, making it an excellent choice for photographers of all skill levels.

The APS-C-sized 24.1MP CMOS sensor of Canon EOS R100 strikes a perfect mix of resolution, file size, speed, and low-light performance, making it ideal for general photography as well as cropped UHD 4K and uncropped Full HD video recording. The R100 produces images with impressive clarity and dynamic range, and it has a native sensitivity range of ISO 100-12800, making it suitable for working in low-light conditions. The sensor and image processor also enable quick performance across the camera system, including the ability to shoot at up to 6.5 fps.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF Systems

The Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology of Canon EOS R100 has 3975 focusing points that cover 143 autofocus zones, providing enhanced precision throughout the whole picture plane. It also enables automated subject identification and Eye identification AF. Designed for speed and precision, our Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology allows you to attain critical focus with every photo.

Flexible Connectivity

Wired and wireless communication options allow for a variety of photo and video transfer techniques, as well as remote camera operation. Physically, the EOS R100 camera has a USB-C connector, a micro-HDMI port, and a 3.5mm microphone port for better video recording. In terms of wireless, Bluetooth connection allows you to connect the camera to compatible smart devices using the free Canon Camera Connect app.

Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens

The Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens of Canon EOS R100 promises to provide a wide zoom range in a small design. It is designed exclusively for Canon's APS-C-format R Series mirrorless cameras, with a wide-angle to short telephoto equivalent zoom range of 29-72mm. Furthermore, the retractable shape makes it suitable for everyday use, if you wish to fit the camera into a bag. Canon has taken care with the optical design, utilizing two aspherical elements and the Super Spectra Coating to decrease aberrations, ghosting, and flare. An Optical Image Stabilizer may provide up to 4 stops of shake correction or up to 6 stops of Coordinated IS when used with a suitable camera body. the lead screw-type STM AF system is fast enough to keep up with speedy continuous focus while being smooth and quiet enough to work for video.

Enhanced Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The innovative Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R50 delivers fast and precise focusing capabilities with 651 high precision autofocus zones. This phase-detection focusing technology improves subject identification and tracking by intelligently recognizing humans, animals, and vehicles and instantly latching onto these things and maintaining tight focus during bursts and video grabs.

Advanced A+ Assist

Enjoy the thrill of creative photography with a broader selection of auto-compatible scenarios of EOS R50. Advanced A+ Assist delivers excellent photography even in challenging conditions such as night vistas and backlit scenes. Overexposure is automatically controlled so that dynamic sceneries or brilliant portraits may be captured, and many continuous photos are taken to generate gorgeous night photographs or macro photography with a deeper depth of focus.

Simple and Convenient Vlogging

The EOS R50 camera enables vlogging and video content production simple and convenient with video recording capabilities such as uncropped UHD 4K movie recording at up to 30 fps, Full-HD High-frame rate movie recording at up to 120 fps, Dual Pixel CMOS AF tracking, and Movie for Close-up Demo Mode. Vertical Movie Mode and Aspect Markers

When viewing films on a smartphone, movie rotation information may be changed during or after recording, allowing videos to be viewed in vertical composition of EOS R50. The Aspect indicators tool shows visual indicators for various aspect ratios that may be desirable when sharing the same file to many social networking platforms. This display considers suitable composition for the many deliverable files that might be produced when editing.

Flexible Connectivity

Wired and wireless communication options enable different means of sharing photographs and movies, as well as livestreaming and remotely operating the camera. The camera is equipped with a USB-C port, a micro-HDMI port, and a microphone port for video recording. Because of its UVC/UAC compatibility, the EOS R50 camera may be used as a web camera to stream live video in Full HD without the need for extra computer software. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Skype, and other online web conferencing services are all compatible. The EOS R5 camera has a built-in Bluetooth connection which allows you to effortlessly link it to compatible smart devices using the free Canon Camera link app. This low-energy wireless connection conserves battery life while allowing remote camera operation.

Pop-Up Flash and Next-Generation Multi-Function Shoe

A built-in pop-up flash of Canon EOS R50 gives additional lighting for working in low-light situations, and the Multi-Function Shoe adds a row of pins to the front of the design to allow for increased accessory versatility. This next-generation sneaker also powers select accessory kinds that previously required separate batteries.

It is designed exclusively for Canon's APS-C-format R Series mirrorless cameras and has a 29-72mm equivalent zoom range. The a6400 Alpha camera is a great addition to the photography portfolio. The Canon EOS R10 is a compact mirrorless camera with a hybrid ethos that emphasizes mobility without compromising capabilities. The R10 introduces an APS-C sensor to the R system, as well as high-speed shooting, clever AF, and excellent 4K video recording to support a multimedia workflow.

APS-C Comes to EOS R

The Canon EOS R10 has a 24.2MP APS-C CMOS sensor, which sits in a resolution sweet spot, strikes a great mix of resolution, file size, speed, and low-light performance. Because the file sizes are small enough to allow for speedy continuous burst shooting and lengthy video recording, this sensor is suited for ordinary photography as well as UHD 4K recording.

DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R10 features a DIGIC X image processor, which was borrowed from the R3, to execute a variety of high-speed activities ranging from continuous shooting to high-resolution video recording. In terms of high-speed shooting, the R10 can shoot at up to 23 frames per second with a quiet electronic shutter or 15 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, with AF and AE readings before each shot. The CPU also contributes to a wide sensitivity range of ISO 100-32000, which is extensible up to ISO 51200 for working in low-light circumstances.

UHD 4K Video Recording

Aside from stills, the Canon EOS R10 supports high-resolution UHD 4K 8-bit recording at up to 60p utilizing a cropped piece of the sensor or at 30p using an oversampled 6K recording area for increased sharpness, moiré reduction, and noise reduction. In addition, 120p recording at up to Full HD quality is enabled for slow-motion playback.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The sophisticated Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology, carried over from the EOS R3, boasts 651 automated AF points that cover the whole sensor area for quicker, more responsive, and more precise focusing performance. This phase-detection focusing technology also features improved subject identification and tracking, with the capacity to distinguish people, animals, and vehicles intelligently, and tracking will automatically lock onto these targets and retain tight focus throughout burst images.

Intuitive Construction

For high-resolution eye-level viewing of EOS R10, a bright, crisp 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder is included. This 0.95x finder benefits from rapid processing with practically no latency, and a speedy 120-fps refresh rate may be set for vivid, realistic motion depiction. A 3.0" vari-angle LCD is also available, which allows you to operate at high, low, and front-facing angles. A touchscreen interface complements the versatile posture, and the excellent 1.04m-dot resolution provides for vivid playback and live view monitoring.

Flexible Connectivity

There are both wired and wireless networking options, allowing for different means of transmitting photographs and movies as well as remotely managing the camera. Physically, the EOS R10 camera has a USB Type-C port, a micro-HDMI port, and a 3.5mm microphone port for video recording. Canon EOS RP Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Canon EOS RP camera offers full-frame photography in a lightweight, user-friendly mirrorless camera. The robust DIGIC 8 Image Processor and the 26.2 Megapixel CMOS sensor make it simple to quickly and accurately capture amazingly detailed photographs, even in dim lighting. Any of the specialized RF lenses, or any EF or EF-S lens with an optional mount adapter, are required for the EOS RP camera to perform to its full potential. This tiny camera is made for visual storytellers who are ready to shoot in full frame.

26.2MP Full-Frame CMOS Sensor and DIGIC 8 Image Processor

Canon EOS RP has a sizable 26.2MP full-frame CMOS sensor, which strikes the perfect combination of high-resolution output, low-light capability, and fast processing speed. The EOS RP offers a broad native sensitivity range from ISO 100–40000 for working in a variety of lighting scenarios when paired with the DIGIC 8 image processor. For use with moving subjects, continuous shooting at a rate of up to 5 fps is also an option.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF

Dual Pixel CMOS AF provides quick and smooth focusing performance. In order to offer a large and dense network of phase-detection collection components throughout the bulk of the image sensor and eliminate focus hunting for faster, more direct control of focus placement, this device includes two distinct photodiodes within each pixel. This focusing mechanism works to swiftly and precisely gain focus when working with still imagery, making it the perfect choice for shooting and tracking moving subjects so that crucial focus is reached with each frame.

3.0-inch Vari-Angle Touch Screen LCD

The 3.0-inch Clear View LCD II vari-angle touch screen on the Canon EOS RP camera has a resolution of 1.04 Megapixels. Bright and crisp, it can be readily adjusted to shoot from a variety of angles, makes taking selfies simple, and it folds away when not in use.

Built-in OLED Electronic Viewfinder

The EOS RP mirrorless camera boasts a high-precision 0.39-inch built-in OLED Electronic Viewfinder with roughly 2.36 million dots and a 22mm eye point. It's remarkably pleasant for composing and evaluating photographs, even while wearing eyeglasses, as it offers a clear, bright, and vivid 100% view in addition to crucial shooting information.

Compatibility with EF/EF-S Lenses

An optional EF-EOS R mount adapter allows the EOS R and RP to use EF and EF-S lenses in addition to RF lenses, providing an almost endless array of creative possibilities. You can add depth to pictures and videos with the EOS R Series cameras thanks to the wide selection of EF and EF-S lenses.

full_description:
Nikon Z5 Full Frame Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Nikon Z5 is an FX-format mirrorless camera with a comprehensive feature set to meet both photo and video needs. Its 24.3MP CMOS sensor and EXPEED 6 engine enable wide sensitivity to ISO 51200, fast shooting at 4.5 fps, and UHD 4K video at 30 fps. A stylish but adaptable physical design that incorporates a magnesium alloy chassis with a weather-sealed construction to suit working adverse conditions goes hand in hand with the sensor and CPU. A back 3.2" 1.04m-dot tilting touchscreen LCD allows for working from high and low angles, and a high-resolution 3.6m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder enables high-res eye-level viewing. Additionally, for simple sharing, built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth operate with the Nikon SnapBridge software to wirelessly transmit photographs and movies and remotely manage the camera.

UHD 4K Video Recording

The Nikon Z5 can record UHD 4K video at up to 30 frames per second and Full HD video at up to 60 frames per second. Movie files can be saved to in-camera memory cards or an optional external recorder via HDMI out. In comparison to Full HD recording, UHD 4K recording uses a 1.7x crop of the center of the frame. Additionally, because a finished UHD 4K video file can be created directly from the camera, in-camera time-lapse photography is also possible.

Sensor-Shift Vibration Reduction

A 5-axis sensor-shift vibration reduction (VR) mechanism that can compensate for up to five stops of stabilization, independent of the lens being used, is built into the body. When using the extra FTZ Adapter, which is required for 3-axis stabilization, this system also functions with modified lenses. Electronic VR is another tool that helps with video recording and makes it possible to shoot with a handheld camera while maintaining steady footage.

Large 3.2" 1.04m-dot LCD screen and 3.69m-dot Electronic Finder

For bright, clear, and vivid image playback and live view shooting, a large 3.2" 1.04m-dot LCD screen is available. The screen is touchscreen and has a tilting design to accommodate working at high and low angles. This allows for more intuitive operation, navigation, and setting control. A 3.69m-dot electronic finder is present for comfortable eye-level viewing.

Dual UHS-II SD card slots

There are two UHS-II SD card slots on the Nikon Z5 Full Frame Mirrorless Digital Camera. Use them in conjunction to separate file types like RAW and JPEG or stills and videos, as well as for automatic backup and overflow storage.

Built-in SnapBridge connectivity

Built-in SnapBridge connectivity allows for remote shooting and the seamless transfer of low-resolution images. A smart device and the camera can communicate using BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) and Wi-Fi. The mobile device can also remotely trigger the shutter and show a live view image from the camera to enable working from a distance.

Approximately 470 shots per charge

The included EN-EL15c rechargeable lithium-ion battery has a capacity of 470 shots on a single charge, and in-camera USB charging is supported even when the camera is in use. In order to extend the amount of time that can be spent shooting, it is also compatible with the optional MB-N10 multi-battery power pack.

Sony A6400 Mirrorless Camera With 18-135mm Lens

The Sony A6400 camera with lens is a compact APS-C-format mirrorless camera with well-rounded picture and video capabilities. It has a dependable build and enough performance to boost creativity. This camera is an excellent companion for recording ordinary moments as well as once-in-a-lifetime adventures, thanks to its proven sensor design, quick and precise AF performance, and smart operability.

24.2MP APS-C Exmor CMOS Sensor

The 24.2MP Exmor CMOS sensor in the APS-C size of Sony A6400 produces smooth, nuanced picture quality with minimum noise and great sensitivity from ISO 100-32000, which can be increased to ISO 102400 for working in low-light circumstances. The sensor has a one-of-a-kind design that makes use of thin copper wire, increased circuit processing, and an improved front-end LSI to improve light-gathering capacities, minimize noise, and raise readout rates for video recording.

BIONZ X Processor

The sensor and BIONZ X processing combination of Sony A6400 also provides a peak continuous-shooting rate of 11 frames per second with AF and AE, or up to 8 frames per second with a quiet shutter, as well as 14-bit raw file output for a wide tone and color range.

UHD 4K Video Recording in XAVC S Format

The ZV-E10 provides full configurable color and gamma settings, allowing users to modify the gamma, black level, knee, color level, and more. For more post-production versatility, use the same S-Log2 Gamma Curve used on high-end Sony Cinema cameras, which squeezes up to 1300% more dynamic range into the video output than typical Rec. 709. Along with the BT.2020 color space, HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) support is available for recording within a wide color gamut, and, in addition to S-Log2, S-Log3 is also available for producing an effective 14-stop dynamic range with increased grading control in the image shadow to mid-tone regions. The feature of Sony A6400 4K video recording also allows for the creation of 8MP stills during playback by capturing a frame from a movie and saving it as a separate file.

4D FOCUS

The Sony A6400 has a strong 4D FOCUS system which contains 425 on-chip phase-detection points as well as 425 contrast-detection regions for perfect focusing in as little as 0.02 seconds, covering practically the full sensor surface. This hybrid AF system's density of focusing points also enables High-density Tracking AF Technology, which is capable of tracking moving subjects in a range of lighting situations.

Body Design and Connectivity

The Tru-Finder 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder provides a bright, high-resolution mode of monitoring at eye level. To accommodate working from high and low angles, a 3.0" 921.6k-dot LCD touchscreen may be rotated 180° upward or 74° downward. The Sony A6400 camera screen also has White Magic technology with an RGBW pixel layout for greater brightness and usage in daytime. The touchscreen design provides access to Touch Focus control for instant focus point selection, as well as a Touchpad feature that allows you to pick a focus point on the screen while looking through the viewfinder.

Image Stabilization and Autofocus

When shooting handheld with shorter shutter rates, optical Steady Shot image stabilization of Sony A6400 helps to decrease the impression of camera wobble for better pictures. This stabilization technique can also be used with sensor-shift image stabilization on some cameras for more effective control of camera blur. Linear autofocus motor enables accurate and silent focusing when shooting movies and delivers rapid and precise autofocus performance. The dedicated AF/MF switch enables rapid switching between focusing systems.

Optical Design

The Sony A6400 camera has two extra-low dispersion elements aid in the reduction of color fringing and chromatic aberrations, resulting in enhanced clarity and color accuracy. One aspherical element aids in the management of distortion and the reduction of spherical aberrations, resulting in higher clarity and precise depiction. When using selective focus techniques, the rounded seven-blade diaphragm adds to a beautiful bokeh effect.

Sony E 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 OSS Lens

The Sony E 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 OSS lens of Sony A6400 is a flexible 27-202.5mm equivalent zoom for APS-C-format E-mount mirrorless cameras with a handy wide-angle to medium telephoto range. This well-rounded lens is well-suited to operating in a range of scenarios, making it a perfect zoom for travel applications, and the image stabilization reduces the impression of camera shake for better picture while shooting handheld.

full_description:
Canon EOS R8 Mirrorless Camera(Only Body)

The Canon EOS R8 Mirrorless Camera is a lightweight, travel-friendly full-frame camera body that delivers strong picture and video capabilities for both photographers and multimedia content developers. The EOS R8 includes a 24.2MP CMOS sensor combined with a DIGIC X processor, which is also included in the EOS R6 Mark II. This combo delivers exceptional stills performance, stunning 4K 60p 10-bit video, and rapid focusing.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The innovative Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R8 delivers incredibly quick and precise focusing performance, with 1053 automated AF points covering the whole sensor surface. This phase-detection focusing technology improves subject identification and tracking by intelligently recognizing people, animals, and cars, immediately latching onto these targets, and keeping tight focus throughout burst and video recordings. Furthermore, the low-luminance limit of this autofocus technology focuses down to a remarkable -6.5 EV for precise focusing in low-light circumstances.

HDR PQ and Canon Log 3

Though the EOS R8 camera can capture amazing video right out of the box, content producers wishing to take the next step in their imaging journey may choose between two powerful video recording options: HDR PQ or Canon Log 3 video recording. HDR PQ recording produces a 10-bit color file that does not require any modification. This 10-bit HDR file is compatible with HDR displays such as TVs, monitors, and smartphones, which provide more color accuracy and dynamic range than regular displays. Canon Log 3 is also accessible for artists who want to modify their video files, providing a 10-bit log file that enables for dramatic highlight and shadow recovery as well as creative color grading.

Livestreaming

The EOS R8 UVC/UAC compatibility allows it to be used as a web camera to stream live video in Full HD to applications such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Skype, and similar video conferencing software. The full-frame image sensor allows for exposure versatility as well as strong background separation when using bright aperture lenses for video conferencing or livestreaming content.

Movie Digital IS

With Movie Digital IS 5-axis image stabilization of EOS R8, you may record steady films with minimal equipment, even while filming handheld. When utilizing an RF lens with optical image stabilization, coordinated management of Movie Digital IS reduces camera-shake vibrations even more.

Flexible Connectivity

Wired and wireless communication options enable different means of sharing photographs and movies, as well as livestreaming and remotely operating the camera. The camera has a remote port, a USB-C connector, a micro-HDMI port, a microphone input, and a headphone jack for sound monitoring. The camera's built-in Bluetooth connection allows you to effortlessly link it to compatible smart devices using the free Canon Camera link app. This low-energy wireless connection conserves battery life while allowing remote camera operation. It also delivers continually updated GPS position data from your phone, allowing you to geotag your photos so you know exactly where you took them.

Tough, Durable Construction

Dual CFexpress Type B memory card slots provide flexible file storing while also promoting high-speed reading and writing to keep up with the quick continuous shooting and high-resolution 8K video recording. Both slots are also XQD memory card compatible.The Z9 is designed for professional use, with an ergonomic form factor and a vertical grip for simple transitioning between horizontal and vertical shooting configurations.

Versatile Connectivity

Matching the professional build quality of EOS R8, the Z9 is fitted with a variety of connectivity options. Full-size HDMI port for video output to an external recorder or monitor. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port for tethering, data transmission, and in-camera battery charging. The Ethernet connector provides a 1000BASE-T wired LAN connection for FTP file transfers. The 10-pin port supports a wide range of accessories and remote connectivity. PC sync port for flash synchronization. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi (2.4 and 5 GHz) allow for wireless file transfer, remote camera control via a mobile device, and operate in conjunction with the NX Mobile Air software for file management. GNSS allows for in-camera geotagging and storage of location information while shooting.

full_description:
Sony Alpha 7C Compact Mirrorless Full-frame Camera (Only Body)

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact Mirrorless Full-frame Camera is the smallest and lightest3 full-frame digital interchangeable-lens camera with optical in-body image stabilization. Breakthroughs in mechanical packaging and structural design have brought no-compromise full-frame camera performance to a new size and weight class that’s made for powerfully simple still and movie content creation.

Expressiveness only possible with a full-frame sensor

The Sony Alpha 7C has A 35-mm full-frame image sensor that is about 30x larger than a 1/2.3-type smartphone sensor and even 2.3x larger than an APS-C sensor. Capturing significantly more light, it opens up new creative possibilities through a wider dynamic range, less noise, and higher perceived resolution. Deep bokeh, using shallow depth of field, is also possible in combination with a bright (wide-aperture) full-frame lens.

Faithfully capture what you see

The Sony Alpha 7C has a back-illuminated Exmor R CMOS sensor and BIONZ X image processing engine that work together beautifully. The extra-large pixels of a 24.2-megapixel10 full-frame sensor collects more light, for a 15-stop11 wide dynamic range and smoother gradations from shadows to highlights. Excellent subjective resolution and reduced noise pair with precise color reproduction for beautifully accurate skin tones and natural textures.

Stunning bokeh, enabled by a full-frame sensor

Bokeh is the selective focus with a blurred background that makes the subject stand out. Portraits or close-ups are enhanced with new meaning and depth. The α7C, with its full-frame sensor, can achieve bokeh when a smaller sensor-size camera with the same f-stop lens might not. When paired with over 50 lenses available from Sony, the α7C becomes an excellent choice for creative photographic composition and movie creation.

Impressive low-light images

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact camera With its large pixel size, in dimly lit situations or at high shutter speeds, the camera takes beautiful pictures with low noise, even when in the high sensitivity range. Standard ISO is from 100 up to ISO 51200 (expandable from ISO 50 to ISO 20480012). Noise reduction is designed to be particularly effective in the common mid-sensitivity range to faithfully reveal textures and detail in shadows.

Express yourself with E-mount lenses

Over 50 Sony E-mount lenses enable broad creative expression, and a full-frame sensor allows you to leverage the full capabilities of Sony lenses. From wide angles to enhanced creative compression effects on telephoto lenses, with the full-frame α7C, the possibilities are endless.

Continuous focus on active subjects

When you're tracking a fast-moving subject, the camera can utilize built-in AI-based Real-time Tracking16. This subject recognition algorithm draws on color, pattern (brightness), subject distance (depth), and face/eye information to recognize and hold onto your subject.

Activate Real-time Tracking anytime, with the AF-ON button

When the focus mode is AF-S, AF-A, AF-C, or DMF, Real-time Tracking can now be activated by the AF-ON button. This is a convenient way to capture moving subjects in snapshots even with the focus mode set to AF-S. Being able to initiate Real-time Tracking simply with a thumb press anytime under AF modes expands your shooting possibilities.

Autofocus works when it is getting dark

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact camera has Advanced algorithms that contribute to high autofocus and distance measurement precision even at light levels as low as EV-422 in the AF-S mode, allowing for shots with precise AF even when scenes are dark.

Take 4K movies to a higher level

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact camera with Enjoy shooting movies with depth of field control, beautiful bokeh, and clean low-light scenes only possible with a full-frame sensor. The α7C shoots 4K (QFHD: 3840×2160) using full-pixel readout and 6K oversampling, for exceptional detail with minimal moiré and jaggies23.

In-camera high-speed, slow-motion effects

It's easy to create movies in-camera at frame rates from 1 to 120/100 fps for up to 60x quick motion and 5x slow motion in Full HD resolution26. Turn everyday motion into extraordinary artistic moments with ease, to add drama and excitement to your movies.

Clear digital audio recording

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact camera supports a digital audio interface through the camera’s Multi-Interface (MI) Shoe. A digital microphone like the ECM-B1M Shotgun Microphone or XLR-K3M XLR Adaptor Kit provides clear digital audio for all kinds of movie recording, enhancing the sound to match the image. Like other MI shoe accessories, no cables or batteries are required, providing unrestrained freedom for movie-making.

Easy vlogging with a cable-free shooting grip

The Sony Alpha 7C Compact Mirrorless Camera is ideal for high-quality imaging during travel and vlogging. For easy one-handed shooting the GP-VPT2BT grip, via wireless Bluetooth connection, puts key camera functions including zoom, record, and shutter controls in easy reach and even converts to a mini-tripod. Match it with the ECM-B1M microphone for a compact, cable-free vlogging system.

Bright and easy LCD monitor

The side-opening, vari-angle LCD monitor is intuitive to use, rotating 176° horizontally and 270° vertically. The large touch-sensitive screen, with approximately 921 thousand dots29, provides optimum visibility even in bright outdoor light. You can frame your shot or selfie from virtually any position and angle for both stills and movies. Touch Tracking, Touch Focus, and Touch Shutter are all supported.

For still-image photographers

A clear view of images in any environment is possible because the viewfinder is properly equipped despite the body’s compact size. The 2.35 million-dot29 XGA OLED Tru-Finder™ electronic viewfinder achieves high contrast and faithful tonal reproduction for fine subject detail display. A smoother image with 120/100fps30 frame rate makes it easy to track moving subjects. To enhance the user experience, the grip hold and shape have been carefully designed, so that compactness and usability are both.

Small and lightweight, yet robust and reliable

Magnesium alloy used for the top, front, and rear covers enhances body durability. For the α7C, camera parts and internal structures were carefully optimized to reduce size and weight. On the one hand, a monocoque structure31 patterned after an airplane design helps to reduce weight while increasing strength, realizing a lightweight camera body with rigid flexibility. And on the other, the shape is supremely ergonomic and also weather-sealed against dust and moisture32 for comfortable and confident shooting in a wide range of conditions.

Take more shots and shoot longer

Despite the compact body, the high-capacity NP-FZ100 battery provides power to capture up to an industry-leading33 740 images34 on a full charge when using the LCD monitor, or 68034 when using the viewfinder. This also allows up to 215 minutes35 of movie recording without a break, when using the LCD monitor. In addition, the USB Type-C connector allows recharging from an AC adaptor or power bank while continuing to shoot, for limitless shooting potential. The Sony Alpha 7C Compact Mirrorless Full-frame Camera comes with a 03 Years Service Warranty (No parts warranty).

full_description:
Canon EOS R DSLR Camera Body

For all their appealing features one of the concerns of using a full-frame camera has been its larger profile, however, the EOS RP is the lightest and smallest Canon EOS full-frame camera to date. * Weighing approx. 440g (body only) while being impressively compact and comfortable to use, the EOS RP is more convenient to carry, shoot with, and store than any previous EOS full-frame camera before. Engineered to work seamlessly with RF lenses, the EOS RP also maintains complete compatibility with EF and EF-S lenses by using one of three optional Mount Adapters. When using EF-S lenses, the EOS RP even crops automatically to reflect the APS-C sized sensor the lenses are designed for. The EOS RP camera features a Canon-developed and produced 35mm full-frame CMOS sensor with approx. 26.2 effective megapixels. It employs the DIGIC 8 Image Processor to enhance the speed of operations across the board. This means fast, efficient performance and phenomenal image quality for big prints. The EOS RP camera's highly responsive Dual Pixel CMOS AF system features 4,779 manually selectable AF points** and can deliver sharp focus within approximately 0.05 seconds***. This means fast action can be captured and focus can be maintained with speed, accuracy and ease. Amazing for nighttime photography or in very low light, the EOS RP camera's brilliant AF can operate in light as dim as a light rating of EV -5^ where other AF systems may fail or search. Phenomenal AF is achieved even when using lenses with high F numbers. This ultra-sensitive AF works in concert with the EOS RP's EVF to clearly capture subjects even when there's limited light. Among the EOS RP camera's manual focus aids, Focus Peaking helps establish the focus area quickly and clearly. With manual focus peaking, the outline of the area in focus is indicated by a colored line. Focus Peaking is usable in conjunction with the EOS RP's Focus Guide feature, and can be customized with peaking color and detection level specifications that fit the project at hand. The EOS RP camera features a high-precision 0.39-inch OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) EVF with approx. 2.36 million dots and a 22mm eyepoint. The electronic viewfinder (EVF) has been created to provide a bright, sharp and colorful 100% view of the subject at hand. Equipped with an aspherical lens, the EVF shows a crisp and vivid image with minimal distortion, even when the eye moves off the center of the visual field. The EOS RP EVF has a bright, 22mm-high eyepoint design that creates a generous 30mm space between your nose and the rear of the viewfinder. This makes it easy to compose and view images in the viewfinder with or without glasses. The EVF's 0.39-inch OLED based display features approximately 2.36 million dots for an incredibly sharp and detailed image that makes it easy to check focus and view the extensive image data that's displayed. The EOS RP camera features a 3.0-inch, 1.04 Megapixel Clear View LCD II Vari-angle Touchscreen LCD. Brightness is adjustable in seven levels. Its extensive flexibility makes it easy to compose and shoot from virtually any angle, making selfies simple and enabling the LCD to fold away when not in use. The brightness of the EVF and the LCD monitor can even be adjusted individually - a first for an EOS camera. Touchscreen features include settings, review and even AF point selection.

full_description:
Canon EOS R7 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The high-performance Canon EOS R7 is an advanced APS-C camera that features a 15 FPS mechanical shutter. It offers the greatest degree of adaptability for taking pictures and videos of quick action, wildlife, and everything in between thanks to its high-speed shooting 32.5 MP sensor, in-body stabilization up to 7 stops with synchronized control IS1, and 4K60p video. The ideal all-purpose camera for serious pros and knowledgeable amateurs.

32.5MP APS-C CMOS Sensor and DIGIC X Processing

The 32.5MP APS-C CMOS sensor is a versatile chip ideal for both photo and video applications because it successfully balances resolution, speed, and low-light performance. The R7 is one of the first APS-C sensors in the EOS R series, and its high-resolution design benefits both photographers and 4K video by offering a 7K area for oversampling footage, which results in better sharpness and quality. The Canon EOS R7 has a DIGIC X image processor that it borrowed from the R3 to execute a number of high-speed activities, including rapid continuous shooting and high-resolution video recording. The Canon EOS R7 Mirrorless Digital Camera can shoot continuously at up to 30 frames per second (fps) using a silent electronic shutter or at 15 fps using a mechanical shutter, with AF and AE readings taken before each frame. A wide sensitivity range of ISO 100-32000, which can be increased to ISO 51200 for use in challenging lighting circumstances, is also made possible by the CPU.

Autofocus and Image Stabilization

Easily and accurately capture photographs of moving objects. Every pixel on the image sensor is used by Canon's very responsive Dual Pixel CMOS AF technology to determine focus, and it covers up to 651 zones that are roughly 100% wide and 100% tall. The IBIS (In-Body Stabilization System) on the Canon EOS R7 offers coordinated control IS and up to 7 stops of shake correction. This may completely alter handheld videography and low-light photography.

2.36m-Dot EVF and Vari-Angle Touchscreen LCD

For high-resolution eye-level viewing, a 2.36 million dot OLED electronic viewfinder is included. A speedy 120 fps refresh rate can be used for vivid, realistic motion representation with this 1.15x-magnification finder, which benefits from the fast processing for almost no latency. A 3.0" vari-angle LCD is also available in addition to the EVF and offers working high, low, and front-facing angles. A touchscreen interface and the crisp 1.62m-dot resolution enable vivid playback and live view monitoring, complementing the flexible position.

Dual Storage Card Slots and Wireless Connectivity

The Canon EOS R7 has two card slots for UHS-II SD memory cards, making use of its small design. Both slots support internal recording of 4K 60p movies as well as burst shooting of approximately 20MP still images at rates of up to 20 fps. Both 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are available for quick file transfers to mobile devices via the Canon Camera Connect app. Bluetooth also enables persistent device connection.

Next-Generation Multi-Function Shoe

The Canon EOS R7 Mirrorless Digital Camera features a multi-function shoe is an improvement over a traditional hot shoe that adds a row of pins to the front of the design to allow for broader accessory functionality and to supply power to some accessory types that often rely on separate batteries. For compatibility with older shoe-mounted attachments, this revised shoe is also compatible with the AD-E1 Multi-Function Shoe Adapter, the ST-E10 Speedlite Transmitter, the DM-E1D Stereo Microphone, and the AD-P1 Smartphone Link Adapter.

24.5MP FX-Format BSI CMOS Sensor and Dual EXPEED 6 Processors

The sensor's back-illuminated construction enables noticeably clean high-sensitivity output for reduced noise when working at high ISO values, up to a native ISO 51200, as well as vivid and smooth quality at sensitivities as low as ISO 100. UHD 4K Video Recording

273-Point Phase-Detect AF System & Vibration Reduction

The Canon EOS R8 Mirrorless Camera is a lightweight, travel-friendly full-frame camera with lens that delivers strong picture and video capabilities for both photographers and multimedia content developers. This combo delivers exceptional stills performance, stunning 4K 60p 10-bit video, and rapid focusing.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The innovative Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R8 delivers incredibly quick and precise focusing performance, with 1053 automated AF points covering the whole sensor surface. This phase-detection focusing technology improves subject identification and tracking by intelligently recognizing people, animals, and cars, immediately latching onto these targets, and keeping tight focus throughout burst and video recordings. Furthermore, the low-luminance limit of this autofocus technology focuses down to a remarkable -6.5 EV for precise focusing in low-light circumstances.

Movie Digital IS

With Movie Digital IS 5-axis image stabilization of EOS R8, you may record steady films with minimal equipment, even while filming handheld. When utilizing an RF lens with optical image stabilization, coordinated management of Movie Digital IS reduces camera-shake vibrations even more.

HDR PQ and Canon Log 3

Though the EOS R8 camera can shoot stunning video straight out of the box, content creators who want to take the next step in their imaging journey can select between two powerful video recording options: HDR PQ video recording or Canon Log 3 video recording. HDR PQ recording generates a 10-bit color file that does not need to be altered. This 10-bit HDR file is compatible with HDR displays, which give more color accuracy and dynamic range than standard displays. Canon Log 3 is also available for artists who want to make changes to their video files, including a 10-bit log file that allows for dramatic highlight and shadow recovery as well as creative color grading.

Livestreaming

The EOS R8 UVC/UAC compatibility allows it to be used as a web camera to stream live video in Full HD to applications such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Skype, and similar video conferencing software. The full-frame image sensor allows for exposure versatility as well as strong background separation when using bright aperture lenses for video conferencing or livestreaming content.

Flexible Connectivity

Wired and wireless communication options allow for many methods of sharing images and movies, as well as livestreaming and remote camera operation. For sound monitoring, the EOS R8 camera with lens has a remote port, a USB-C connector, a micro-HDMI port, a microphone input, and a headphone jack. Using the free Canon Camera link app, you can easily connect the camera to compatible smart devices thanks to its built-in Bluetooth connection. This low-energy wireless link extends battery life while offering remote camera control. It also continuously updates your phone's GPS position data, allowing you to geotag your images so you know exactly where you took them.

Tough, Durable Construction

Dual CFexpress Type B memory card slots provide flexible file storing while also promoting high-speed reading and writing to keep up with the quick continuous shooting and high-resolution 8K video recording. Both slots are also XQD memory card compatible. The EOS R8 camera with lens is designed for professional use, with an ergonomic form factor and a vertical grip for simple transitioning between horizontal and vertical shooting configurations.

Versatile Connectivity

Matching the professional build quality of EOS R8,  is fitted with a variety of connectivity options. Full-size HDMI port for video output to an external recorder or monitor. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port for tethering, data transmission, and in-camera battery charging. The Ethernet connector provides a 1000BASE-T wired LAN connection for FTP file transfers. The 10-pin port supports a wide range of accessories and remote connectivity. PC sync port for flash synchronization. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi (2.4 and 5 GHz) allow for wireless file transfer, remote camera control via a mobile device, and operate in conjunction with the NX Mobile Air software for file management. GNSS allows for in-camera geotagging and storage of location information while shooting.

Canon RF 24-50mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens (Canon RF)

The RF 24-50mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens is a versatile standard zoom with a lightweight and compact construction that covers wide-angle to normal-view focal lengths. This lens is ideal for landscapes, cityscapes, street scenes, portraits, products, and more. It is designed for everyday usage and is an excellent choice for vlogging and content creation. An STM stepping AF motor provides quick, smooth, and near-silent autofocus performance for both stills and video recording, while an Optical Image Stabilizer adjusts for up to 4.5 stops of camera shake to allow for sharp handheld photography in low-light circumstances. The STM stepping motor provides fast, quiet, smooth, and precise autofocus performance that is suited for both video and still photography. Optical Image Stabilizer technology compensates for up to 4.5 stops of camera shake, making it easier to take clear handheld images in low-light circumstances. When used in conjunction with EOS R-series cameras equipped with an In-Body Image Stabilizer (IBIS), it provides up to 7 stops of shake correction. On the lens barrel, there is a focus control ring that allows you to directly modify a variety of settings such as shutter speed, aperture, exposure compensation, and more. This ring, which is located near the front of the lens, effectively adds a third dial to the camera's main dial and quick control dial.

Sony Alpha a7R IIIA Full-Frame Mirrorless Camera (Body Only)

Sony a7R IIIA is a high-performance mirrorless camera. It provides the best resolution, speed, and video capabilities. This works with the BIONZ X processor which offers high-resolution images and videos that minimize noise and improve speed. To increase light collection and improve detail, this sensor structure combines a gapless on-chip lens design with an anti-reflection coating and does away with the optical low-pass filter. Image Stabilization

And make an image or video perfect from the camera shake. It helps to correct the pitch and yaw adjustment for a long focal length. 5-axes of stabilization functions all the time though the user used third-party lenses and adapters or lenses.

AF System

Sony a7R IIIA has a fast hybrid AF system that has double focusing speed and a tracking system. It has a 4D focus system that covers 68% of the frame and allows 425 contrast-detection area which helps for quick autofocus and subject tracking performance. Lock-on AF systems are reliable for focusing on moving subjects. Eye AF is available in both AF-S and AF-C modes that are used for recognizing human subjects' eyes for portraits. The touch screen is used for touch focus control and this mode helps a user to use the rare screen intuitively. By switching in orientation, the user can get more focus control.The AF tracking sensitivity can be adjusted in five stages to match a subject's movements.

UHD 4K Video Recording in XAVC S Format

It uses a 5K capture area. The usage of an optional external recorder for clear 4K recording with 4:2:2 sampling is also made possible by the high-resolution internal recording and uncompressed HDMI output. It also supports 1080p full HD recording with a frame rate of up to 120 fps.

LCD Screen

The Sony a7R IIIA has an updated Quad-VGA OLED Tru-Finder EVF with 3.69m- dot resolution. Standard and high-quality settings can be used based on shooting situations to optimize viewing incidents. A dot-rated LCD is also included here which has a touch panel design for operating focusing control. The screen can tilt upwards and downwards to get benefits from a high and low angle.

Connectivity

So it can be used for recording professionally balanced XLR audio signals. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available for audio monitoring. Built-in wifi helps to share images to mobile devices, social media, and online via email and cloud storage. NFC 5 technology is also supported for a one-touch connection with the device. The linking mobile device can display the images on the screen while connecting. For collecting location data, Bluetooth connectivity is used here.

Reliable Construction

In the Sony a7R IIIA, the grip strength has been improved for more easy handholding, and the lens mount has been improved to better support heavy lenses. Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera features Dual Pixel CMOS AF II, In-body Image Stabilization, 4K video capability, People and Animal Detection, and more. It has been designed to satisfy the needs of both photographers and makers of video content who need a robust and adaptable camera to keep up with their active lives. Thanks to its high-performance CMOS sensor and DIGIC X image processor, it can effortlessly switch between shooting fast-paced action sports and 4K cinematic footage.

20MP Full-Frame Sensor and DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R6 delivers moderate resolution to match a more manageable workflow, especially for individuals working with the web and tiny print forms as their final output. It is built around a redesigned 20MP full-frame CMOS sensor. Together with the optimized DIGIC X image processor, this sensor offers outstanding still and video capabilities as well as sensitivity ranging from ISO 100-102400 and expandable to ISO 204800.

4K60 and Full HD 120 Video Recording

The 20MP sensor offers UHD 4K video recording at up to 60 frames per second in addition to Full HD at 120 frames per second for slow-motion playback. Both Canon Log and HDR-PQ are available for internal recording in both formats at 4:2:2 10-bit for high dynamic range output and more control over color rendering. Additionally, external recording through the HDMI connection offers clear 4K output to an optional external recording, and Dual Pixel CMOS AF is enabled for all recording settings.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The Canon EOS R6 camera offers a highly responsive Dual Pixel CMOS AF II system. The 1053 selectable focusing points of the upgraded Dual Pixel CMOS AF II provide wide and even coverage, covering almost 100% of the image frame. Similar to how a camcorder gains focus, this focusing technology offers quick and smooth performance. In order to eliminate focus hunting and offer a wide and dense network of phase-detection collection elements throughout most of the image sensor, this technology includes two independent photodiodes within each pixel. This allows for quicker, more precise control of focus placement.

Sensor-Shift Image Stabilizer

The R6 has five-axis sensor-shift image stabilization, a first for EOS cameras, that can effectively adjust for up to an amazing eight stops of camera shake to accommodate handheld shooting with slower shutter speeds. Additionally, for both native RF lenses and adapted EF lenses, this stabilization technology functions in conjunction with lens-based optical image stabilization.

0.5-type OLED EVF with Approx. 3.69 Million Dots

The Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera has a high-precision 0.5-inch OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) EVF with about 3.69 million dots and a 23mm eyepoint. A bright, clear, and colorful 100% view of the subject is offered by the EOS R6's EVF, which supports a 120 fps refresh rate. when switching from a landscape to a portrait arrangement, displaying a clear image and a wealth of shooting data that rotates with the camera's angle.

Dual Storage Card Slots and Wireless Connectivity

The EOS R6 camera has two card slots for UHS-II SD memory cards, making use of its small design. Both slots support internal recording of 4K 60p movies as well as burst shooting of approximately 20MP still images at rates of up to 20 fps. Both 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are available for quick file transfers to mobile devices via the Canon Camera Connect app. Bluetooth also enables persistent device connection.

Dust- & Water-resistant Sealing

The Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera is made to work in a range of weather conditions. Critical locations including the buttons, terminal covers, battery compartment, and card slot lid are sealed with sealing materials. The rest of the camera body's exposure to inadvertent dust and moisture is reduced thanks to precise design and manufacture.

Shutter Durability

Canon EOS R6 Mirrorless Digital Camera has a full-frame focal-plane shutter that enables around 12 shots per second and a durability rating of about 300,000 cycles.

Sony ZV-E1 Mirrorless Camera(Only Body)

The ultra-compact black Sony ZV-E1 Mirrorless Camera, designed as a professional photo & cinema camera for content makers looking to raise their game, delivers cinematic looks to your vlogs, interviews, and product demos. The ZV-E1 boasts a full-frame 12MP Exmor R CMOS sensor and a BIONZ XR image processor in a compact, mobile shape that is even smaller than the EV-10 and has the cinema-style inner-workings of the a7S III. Its full-frame E-mount makes it one of the tiniest interchangeable lens cameras available. The ZV-E1 has a cinematic bokeh, 15+ stops of dynamic range, 5-axis stabilization, AI-based auto-framing, AF assist, numerous mic choices, USB streaming, a dust and moisture resistant housing, and other features.

12MP Exmor R CMOS Sensor + BIONZ XR Processor + AI

The 12.1MP full-frame CMOS sensor has 2.5x the picture size of an APS-C sensor, a back-illuminated Exmor R design, an improved BIONIC XR image processor, and a new, dedicated AI processing unit. The Sony ZV-E1 camera captures low-light shots with an amazing ISO range of 80-102,400 with an enhanced ISO range of 80-409,600, 15+ stops of dynamic range, and a stunning, cinematic bokeh for photo stills and video.

Recording Flexibility

Slow-motion video recording is possible with the high-speed 120 fps recording, or an effective 240 fps frame rate is offered with Full HD resolution for even better motion control. The Sony ZV-E1 is ideal for long-form recording since it has no recording time constraints, allowing for infinite clip lengths. The camera's physical design also has an enhanced heat-dissipating structure, allowing for extended prospective recording periods of up to 60 minutes at 4K60p.

Advanced Color Control

S-Cinetone, which is based on technologies from professional Cinema Line of Sony ZV-E1 cameras like as the VENICE, may be utilized to create unique colors and healthy-looking skin tone rendering that matches the a7S III, FX9, and FX6 cameras. This color profile has natural midtones, gentle hues, and well-controlled highlights.

5-Axis Image Stabilization

The Sony ZV-E1 has a next-generation 5-axis optical image stabilization technology that adjusts for five distinct forms of camera shake encountered during handheld still and video photography. This enables users to comfortably utilize any lens, even adapted lenses, for important images without experiencing blur caused by camera motion.When walking with the camera, optical active mode improves picture stabilization, and dynamic active mode adds electrical stabilization, which is even more effective when employing quick motions and longer lens lengths.

Autofocus and Image Stabilization

The Autofocus function of Sony ZV-E1 camera includes a variety of options such as focus breathing compensation, adjustable AF transition speed settings, and AF subject shift sensitivity settings. It has a focus map and AF assist capabilities for quick, precise focusing.

AI Processing Unit

The numerous Face Recognition option instructs the Sony ZV-E1 camera to monitor numerous persons in the frame at the same time. It aids in framing stability and automatically monitors your subject in frame to ensure that it remains within the frame.

Slow and Quick Motion

Up to 10x slow motion with Full HD quality at 240 fps (24p recording) is possible with the XAVC S format, enabling new views on dynamic sports and other sorts of action with Sony ZV-E1 camera.

Audio and Pro Video Features

The Sony ZV-E1 camera has an inbuilt three-capsule mic, a mic jack, and a Multi-interface (MI) shoe for connecting to a digital audio interface. A 3.5mm headphone jack is also included. To protect the internal microphone, a windshield is incorporated. It has a tally lamp, a bespoke video control structure, an integrated shooting grip, and a self timer for professional use.

Connectivity and Streaming

Using a smartphone app, the Sony ZV-E1 camera may be connected to the Creators' Cloud central cloud platform to share and save media, edit in the cloud, and use collaborative capabilities. full_description:
Sony a7 IV 33MP Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Sony a7 IV 33MP Mirrorless Camera The Sony a7 IV is an all-arounder that goes above and beyond the basics, with great stills and video capabilities. The a7 IV is a sophisticated hybrid mirrorless camera with high resolution and AF performance that appeals to photographers, as well as strong 4K 60p video recording for filmmakers and content producers.

33MP Exmor R BSI CMOS Sensor

The newly developed 33MP Exmor R full-frame sensor features a back-illuminated design that promotes high clarity, low noise, and vivid color rendering. This design benefits working in low-light conditions and works in conjunction with a broad sensitivity range of ISO 100-51200. The sensor's design also achieves an impressive dynamic range of approximately 15 stops and files can be recorded in raw, JPEG, or the 10-bit HEIF format.

BIONZ XR Processor

The Sony a7 IV 33MP Mirrorless Camera Using the flagship-class BIONZ XR engine, high-speed image processing capabilities are available for fast continuous shooting, 4K video recording, and advanced AF tracking performance. The quick processing also helps to reduce rolling shutter and other motion distortions for the clean rendering of moving subjects. In terms of shooting speeds, the sensor and processor enable up to 10 fps shooting, using either the mechanical or electronic shutter and with AF/AE enabled. Also, the buffer permits recording up to 828 consecutive uncompressed raw + JPEG frames when using a CFexpress Type A card.

4K 60p recording, 4:2:2 10-bit recording

The Sony a7 IV 33MP Mirrorless Camera gives you an impressive range of video recording options. Full pixel readout without binning allows 4K 60p recording, and when recording 4K movies at 30p, full-frame 7K oversampling22 produces high-resolution, highly detailed 4K. 10-bit 4:2:2 video can be recorded internally, allowing fuller, more natural gradations and greater editing freedom. The XAVC HS file format provides roughly twice the coding efficiency of MPEG-4 AVC/H.264.

Optical 5-axis in-body image stabilization for 5.5-step compensation

The sony α7 IV's high-precision stabilization unit and gyro sensors work with stabilization algorithms to achieve up to 5.5 steps of shutter-speed compensation, to maximize the performance of the camera's 33.0MP sensor. This in-body stabilization allows effective use with a wide range of lenses. The live monitor view shows the stabilized still image while the shutter button is half-pressed, an especially helpful feature when using a telephoto or macro lens, and it can be used in conjunction with the MF Assist and Focus Magnifier features.

Communication features for easy sharing and distribution

The Sony a7 IV 33MP Mirrorless Camera is equipped with robust wired and wireless communication features for more comfortable sharing and distribution. In-body wireless LAN uses a 5GHz band in addition to the 2.4GHz band, for fast data transfer. Background FTP transfer of files can be set to occur automatically while shooting continues, and a USB Type-C connector supports fast SuperSpeed USB 10Gbps (USB 3.2 Gen 2) data transfer.

full_description:
Sony a7R IVA 61MP Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Sony a7R IVA 61MP Mirrorless Camera continues the notable line of extremely capable full-frame cameras, distinguished by exceptional stills and video performance and adaptability, and moves to a higher resolution area. The a7R 4th generation has an upgraded 61MP sensor, quicker processing, enhanced AF performance, and a more well-rounded feature set for both high-end picture and video applications. The newly built full-frame 61MP Exmor R CMOS sensor with a back-illuminated architecture gives amazing resolution with great clarity, low noise, and a broad 15-stop dynamic range. The shape of the sensor supports exceptional picture quality, and a copper wire layer substantially boosts data transfer speed for capturing 14-bit, high-resolution 61MP stills with a base sensitivity range of ISO 100-32000, which can be increased to ISO 50-102400.

BIONZ X Image Processor

The Sony a7R IVA Mirrorless Camera's BIONZ X engine's high-speed image processing enables the quick continuous shooting, 4K video recording, and improved AF tracking. The rapid processing also aids in the reduction of rolling shutter and other motion aberrations for the clear portrayal of moving subjects. In terms of shooting rates, the sensor and CPU enable up to 10 fps shooting at full resolution for up to 68 consecutive frames, with full-time AF/AE.

Pixel Shift Multi Shooting

This unique compositing mode allows you to achieve even greater resolution than the 61MP sensor affords. Working in conjunction with the sensor-shift image stabilization, this mode shifts the sensor while making 16 consecutive exposures to acquire approximately 240.8MP of information for greater color accuracy and detail than possible with a single exposure, along with an impressive image size of 19,008 x 12,672 pixels. These files can then be merged during post-production by using the Sony Imaging software suite.

Fast Hybrid AF System

An updated Fast Hybrid AF system now employs a combination of 567 phase-detection points, which cover approximately 99.7% of the height and 74% of the width of the frame, along with 425 contrast-detection areas for reliable and quick autofocus and subject tracking performance. This focusing system also achieves especially quick speed and reliable tracking, as well as enhanced low-light focusing response down to -3 EV. The apt focus system also lends itself to a variety of focusing functions for refined accuracy, including Lock-on AF, which maintains focus on moving subjects throughout the use of a configurable frame that is set over the desired moving subject and Expand Flexible Spot, which employs neighboring focus points to retain focus on moving subjects even if the originally selected point loses focus. Additionally, Eye AF can be used to base focus on recognized human subjects' eyes for portraits and is available in both AF-S and AF-C modes, for both stills and video. Eye AF can be used when photographing animal subjects, too, with any focusing mode when shooting stills. Autofocus can also be used in conjunction with the Focus Magnifier function for critical focus when homing in on minute subject details. The rear touchscreen can also be used for Touch Focus control, and a Touchpad Focus Control mode lets you use the rear screen intuitively while keeping your eye on the viewfinder.

5-Axis SteadyShot INSIDE Image Stabilization

The Sony a7R IVA includes a 5.5-stop effective 5-axis SteadyShot INSIDE image stabilization technology that adjusts for five different forms of camera shaking experienced during handheld stills and video shooting. This enables users to comfortably utilize any lens, even adapted lenses, for important images without experiencing blur caused by camera motion. The device will compensate for pitch and yaw modifications for extended focal lengths. The incorporation of horizontal and vertical shift correction, on the other hand, will assist macro and high-magnification pictures. The roll adjustment will be useful for all shooting techniques. Even when using third-party lenses and adapters or lenses with built-in optical stabilization, all 5 axes of stabilization will operate at all times.

UHD 4K Video Recording in XAVC S Format

The Sony a7R IVA Mirrorless Camera has Internal recording of UHD 4K movies is supported at several frame rates up to 30 fps and, based on the Super35mm recording area and effective 6K resolution, oversampling produces additional detail and complete pixel readout is feasible, allowing for a higher quality picture with decreased moiré and aliasing. Full-frame 4K recording has also been significantly enhanced for increased quality while working at mid to high sensitivities, allowing full utilization of the sensor width. Full HD 1080p recording at frame rates up to 120 fps is also possible, and both resolutions use the 100 Mbps XAVC S codec housed behind an MP4 wrapper with 4:2:0 sampling. The 120 fps recording speed also allows for 4x and 5x slow-motion video recording at 30p or 24p frame rates. Uncompressed HDMI output permits the use of an optional external recorder for clean 4K recording with 4:2:2 sampling in addition to high-resolution internal recording. 4K video recording also allows for the creation of 8MP stills during playback by capturing a frame from a movie and saving it as a separate file.

Body Design and Connectivity

An upgraded UXGA OLED Tru-Finder EVF with a 5.76m-dot resolution is included, and a dedicated High-quality preset offers a 120 fps refresh rate for extremely smooth playback of moving subjects. In addition to the EVF, a 3.0" 2.36m-dot rear LCD with a touch panel design is provided for simple operation and focusing adjustment. In addition, the screen tilts upward 107° and downward 41° to facilitate working from high and low angles. While staying lightweight, the magnesium alloy chassis ensures stiffness, longevity, and stability. The lens attachment has also been modified to help accommodate heavier lenses, as has the grip stiffness for more comfortable hand-holding. Extensive weather-sealing has been used to withstand dust and moisture for dependable operation in extreme weather situations, including increased sealing around the battery cover, terminal cover, and chassis joints. The a7R IVA's battery life is rated at roughly 530 shots per charge with the EVF or 660 shots with the rear LCD, using the same NP-FZ100 battery as its predecessor. Dual SD memory card slots provide versatile file storage and processing, and may be set to divide raw and JPEG files or to record overflow data. Both of the card slots are rated to support UHS-II memory cards for faster transfer speeds. Integrated PC sync terminal for wired flash sync with strobe packs or wireless radio remotes. A USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C port has been added, in addition to a micro-USB port, for faster, more reliable tethering support. The USB Type-C connection allows the camera to be charged from the host power source while connected. Updated Multi Interface Shoe supports working with the optional ECM-B1M Shotgun Microphone or XLR-K3M XLR Adapter Kit, which provide improved, clear audio recording sound by sending a digital audio signal to the camera, opposed to an analog signal. In addition, the a7R IVA has a 3.5mm microphone input connector for use with external microphones. The a7R IVA's built-in Wi-Fi allows it to rapidly transmit imagery to mobile devices for direct sharing online to social networking sites, via email, and cloud storage services. Wireless tethered shooting is also possible with support for both the 2.4 and 5.0 GHz bands. NFC (Near Field Communication) is also available, allowing for a one-touch connection between the camera and compatible mobile devices with no complicated setup. When connected, the linked mobile device may also display a live view image on its screen and activate the shutter of the camera remotely.

full_description:
Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Only Body)

The Canon EOS R6 Mark II camera is a flexible mirrorless camera for the multimedia maker, combining great picture performance with adequate video capabilities. An new 24.2MP CMOS sensor works in tandem with enhanced processor to deliver superior AF, 4K 60p 10-bit video, and quicker overall performance. The camera body has also been changed for improved handling, with a new top plate for easy access to multiple shooting settings.

Updated Full-Frame Sensor

The EOS R6 Mark II contains a new 24.2MP CMOS sensor that's adaptable for both picture and video applications, works well in low-light circumstances, and produces beautiful and true colors.

DIGIC X Processor

The EOS R6 Mark II enhanced processing, borrowed from the R3, complements the camera's multimedia capabilities. The DIGIC X enables up to 40 frames per second continuous shooting with a quiet electronic shutter or 12 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, including AF and AE readings before each shot. There's also a 30 fps RAW Burst mode with pre-release capture to catch moments up to 0.5 seconds before you hit the shutter.

UHD 4K Video Recording

Aside from stills, the EOS R6 Mark II sensor supports high-resolution UHD 4K 60p internal video using the whole width of the sensor, as well as 10-bit sampling with Canon Log 3. A 6K recording area may also be utilized for oversampled 4K 30p shooting for increased clarity, moiré reduction, and noise reduction. In addition, 180p recording at up to Full HD quality is enabled for slow-motion playback.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The Advanced Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology of EOS R6 Mark II has 1053 automated AF points that span the whole sensor area and deliver very fast, responsive, and precise focusing performance. This phase-detection focusing system also features improved subject identification and tracking, thanks to deep learning technology, and can distinguish humans, animals, and cars intelligently. Subject tracking will automatically latch onto these subjects and keep them in great focus when shooting, even during burst snaps and video recording.

Sensor-Shift Image Stabilizer

When shooting handheld in low-light circumstances, an In-Body Image Stabilizer (IBIS) of EOS R6 Mark II corrects up to 7 stops of undesirable camera shaking. It also helps to decrease shake when filming movies. This 5-axis system may also be used in conjunction with optical image stabilization lenses to compensate for up to 8 stops of camera shaking, depending on the lens in use. Additionally, Movie Digital IS employs optical and sensor-shift stabilization techniques, in addition to digital IS, to assist collect more stable video while moving.

EVF and Vari-Angle Touchscreen LCD

The high-resolution 3.69m-dot 0.5" electronic viewfinder is bright and crisp for eye-level viewing, and the rapid 120 fps refresh rate of EOS R6 Mark II enables natural motion depiction for a more realistic viewfinder experience. The rear 3.0" 1.62m-dot LCD touchscreen has a vari-angle design that advantages both front-facing filming, such as for vlogging, and working from high and low shooting angles. A joystick controller is employed on the rear of the camera for fast and easy focus point selection and menu navigation, as well as four separate control knobs around the body for intuitive tactile control.

Reliable and Intuitive Handling

The EOS R6 Mark II camera has On/Off dial and Photo/Video mode dial which have been repositioned on the redesigned top plate for more straightforward use. This camera has a dust- and moisture-sealed housing structure that makes it suited for operating in harsh weather. Dual SD memory card slots provide file-saving options, and both are UHS-II card graded to allow 4K video recording and high-speed continuous shooting.

Flexible Connectivity

There are both wired and wireless networking options, allowing for different means of transmitting photographs and movies as well as remotely managing the camera. USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 connector for in-camera charging and file transfers; this port also allows the EOS R6 Mark II camera to be used as a Full HD 30p webcam with UVC/UAC protocol capability. Ports for 3.5mm headphones and an external microphone. Micro-HDMI input for use with an external recorder. Bluetooth and 5/2.4 GHz Wi-Fi for mobile device wireless transfers and remote camera control.

Nikon Z7 II Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

Nikon Z7 II is a full-frame mirrorless camera for individuals who obsess over the smallest details. There's 45.7 megapixels of resolution with no optical low-pass filter. The strength of dual processors. 60p 4K Ultra HD video. The 493-point autofocus system of the future. High-speed shooting with adequate buffer capacity. There are two card slots. There are numerous creative characteristics. Power options that are adaptable. It is compatible with a vertical battery grip. Wireless connectivity for cellphones, computers, and other devices.

45.7MP FX-Format BSI CMOS Sensor and Dual EXPEED 6 Processors

To improve continuous shooting, movies, and time-lapse recording, a 45.7MP BSI CMOS sensor is used in Z7 II for high-resolution shooting, exceptional low-light quality, and rapid readout times. The sensor's back-illuminated design provides significantly clear high-sensitivity output and decreased noise while operating at high ISO values, up to a native ISO 25600, as well as vibrant and smooth quality at low ISO values as low as ISO 64. In order to gain the best sharpness and resolution from the sensor, the sensor's design also omits the typical optical low-pass filter. Dual EXPEED 6 image processors benefit the sensor by providing a plethora of speed across the camera system, including the ability to shoot continuously at 10 fps for up to 50 consecutive frames.

UHD 4K Video Recording

The Z7 II is a competent multimedia camera that makes use of the sensor and processor capabilities. UHD 4K video recording is available up to 60p, while Full HD 1080p video recording is supported up to 120p for slow motion playback. Video files can be saved to the in-camera memory cards or as an uncompressed file to an optional external recorder via HDMI out.

493-Point Phase-Detect AF System & Vibration Reduction

The Nikon Z7 II comes with an array of 493 phase-detect autofocus points located on the sensor cover 90% of the image area both vertically and horizontally. This allows fast and accurate focusing for both stills and video, and with a wide coverage area, subject tracking will work out to the frame's edges. For video, hybrid AF is available, which automatically switches between phase- and contrast-detect systems to provide smooth focus throughout shooting. Furthermore, the latest NIKKOR Z lenses are intended for silent operation. Regardless of the Z-type lens employed, in-body 5-axis sensor-shift Vibration Reduction adjusts for up to 5 stops of camera shake. This system also works with modified F-mount lenses with 3-axis stabilization when using the optional FTZ Adapter.

Large 3.2" 2.1m-dot LCD screen and 3.6m-dot OLED Electronic Finder

For bright, crisp, and vivid image playback and live view filming, a 3.2" 2.1m-dot LCD screen is provided. The screen is tilted to benefit from working from both high and low angles, and it is also a touchscreen for more intuitive operation, navigation, and setting control. The Nikon Z7 II Mirrorless Digital Camera also has a 3.6m-dot electronic finder for comfortable eye-level viewing. It boasts a high magnification of 0.80x and employs NIKKOR optics to ensure a sharp, clear image. The finder also includes a Fluorine coating for easier cleaning.

Built-in SnapBridge connectivity

Nikon Z7 II Full Frame Mirrorless Digital Camera comes with built-in SnapBridge connectivity for easy transfer of low-resolution imagery and remote shooting capabilities. BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) and Wi-Fi enable the connection between the camera and a smart device; additionally, the mobile device can remotely trigger the shutter and display a live view image from the camera to enable working from a distance.
