Sony Alpha 7S III Mirrorless Full-frame Camera (Only Body)

The Sony Alpha 7S III Mirrorless Full-frame Camera increases the standard for what a full-frame mirrorless camera is capable of, with enhanced video, sensitivity, and speed. Along with UHD 4K 120p video recording and internal 10-bit 4:2:2 sampling, a revamped 12.1MP Exmor R BSI CMOS sensor, and enhanced BIONZ XR image processor provide quicker performance, greater noise reduction, and a broader dynamic range. With 12.1 effective megapixels15, the newly designed back-illuminated full-frame Exmor RTM CMOS sensor has a reading speed up to twice as fast as the 7S II, as well as great sensitivity and a broad dynamic range. A sophisticated color filter array improves color reproduction accuracy, while focal plane phase-detection AF improves autofocus stability and precision, all of which contribute to exceptional image quality.

12.1MP Exmor RS BSI CMOS Sensor and BIONZ XR Processor

The Sony Alpha 7S III camera boasts a revised 12.1MP full-frame CMOS sensor with a back-illuminated Exmor RS design for greater clarity and noise reduction, as well as the expectedly high sensitivity range of ISO 80-102400 with an increased ISO 40-409600 range. The improved sensor design also results in 2x quicker readout speeds than prior generations, and when combined with the upgraded BIONZ XR image processor, eliminates rolling shutter by 3x and provides up to 8x faster processing and overall camera handling. The sensor and CPU combination also contributes to a broad dynamic range of up to 14 stops for stills and 15 stops for video, as well as 10 frames per second continuous shooting for up to 1000 uncompressed raw files for stills.

Video Recording

The Sony Alpha 7S III Mirrorless Full-frame Camera can record UHD 4K at frame speeds up to 120p using full 1:1 pixel readout without binning. Internal 10-bit 4:2:2 sampling is also supported in all recording modes, and 16-bit raw output is available when recording externally through the full-size HDMI A connection for even greater tone reproduction and post-production versatility. Two codecs have also been developed: XAVC HS, which employs HEVC/H.265 encoding to maintain greater detail at lower bitrates, and XAVC S-I, an intraframe codec providing constant performance and quality at bitrates up to 600 Mb/s.

Recording Flexibility

The high-speed, 120 fps recording enables 4x and 5x slow-motion movie recording with the frame rate playback set to either 30p or 24p or, if moving down to Full HD resolution, an effective 240p frame rate is also available for even greater motion control. Suiting long-form recording, the a7S III does not have any recording time limits to allow for unlimited clip lengths. The camera's physical design also features an improved heat-dissipating structure to promote longer possible recording times, up to an approximate 60-minute recording time at 4K60p.

Autofocus and Image Stabilization

The Sony Alpha 7S III Full-Frame Mirrorless Camera A Fast Hybrid AF system with 759 phase-detection points and 425 contrast-detection regions covers 92% of the picture area for rapid and precise focusing in a variety of lighting settings with sensitivity down to -6 EV. This focusing method is used in all recording modes, making it useful for both video and still applications. It can also latch onto topics rapidly and employ Real-time Tracking for AI-based tracking on moving subjects or touch tracking for manual subject selection. Real-time Eye AF offers vital sharpness while taking portraits and is ideal for both humans and animals. The seven-step AF transition speed and five-step AF topic shift sensitivity adjustments allow you to fine-tune how rapidly focus switches from point to point and how smoothly focusing transitions occur.

5-Axis SteadyShot INSIDE Image Stabilization

The Sony Alpha 7S III has an improved 5.5-stop effective 5-axis SteadyShot INSIDE image stabilization technology that adjusts for five forms of camera shaking experienced during handheld stills and video shooting. This enables users to comfortably utilize any lens, even adapted lenses, for important images without experiencing blur caused by camera motion. The device will compensate for pitch and yaw modifications for extended focal lengths. The incorporation of horizontal and vertical shift correction, on the other hand, will assist macro and high-magnification pictures. The roll adjustment will be useful for all shooting techniques. Even when using third-party lenses and adapters or lenses with built-in optical stabilization, all 5 axes of stabilization will operate at all times. Additionally, specifically for video, there is also an Active IS mode that adds even more precise stabilization methods for even smoother footage straight out of the camera.

Body Design and Connectivity

A stunning QXGA OLED Tru-Finder EVF with a high 9.44m-dot resolution and 0.9x magnification provide extraordinarily bright, crisp, and detailed eye-level viewing. This viewfinder boasts a dedicated 120 fps High-Quality option for smooth motion rendering, as well as a long 25mm eye point, 41° field of vision, and a fluorine coating on the outermost viewfinder element to aid in cleaning. A side-opening 3.0" 1.44m-dot vari-angle articulating screen helps work from high and low angles as well as a front-facing position for vlogging or other self-recording purposes, which is a first for a7-series cameras. This LCD also has a touchscreen for easy shooting control and menu navigation. The redesigned menu layout is more user-friendly and compliments having separate processes and settings options for video recording and still photography. The menu system also works in tandem with the back LCD's touchscreen design.

Ports and Connectivity

The Sony Alpha 7S III Mirrorless Full-frame Camera features a Full-size HDMI A connector, which provides a more dependable connection for dealing with external recorders. A USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C connector, in addition to a micro-USB port, has been added for speedier, more reliable tethering capability. The USB Type-C connector allows the camera to be charged or operated from the host power supply while attached. Both the 3.5mm headphone and external microphone connectors provide more control over audio recording. It contains a Multi Interface Shoe that allows it to function with the optional ECM-B1M Shotgun Microphone or XLR-K3M XLR Adapter Kit, which enables better, clearer audio recording sound by providing a digital audio signal to the camera rather than an analog signal. This camera's built-in Wi-Fi offers remote camera control and rapid image sharing to mobile devices for direct internet sharing, and compatibility for both the 2.4 and 5 GHz bands permits wireless tethered shooting. This connection also allows for remote camera operation. To allow 1000BASE-T networking, wired remote shooting, or FTP transmitting, the USB Type-C connector may be combined with an optional Ethernet wired LAN adapter. Nikon Z9 Mirrorless Camera(Only Body)

The Nikon Z9 is a professional-grade camera that offers connection, speed, and image quality. Its enhanced AF performance, freshly designed sensor, and high-resolution 8K video recording are its standout features. The Nikon Z9, their first mirrorless flagship camera, is notable for being a camera that photographers and filmmakers using a range of applications will find appealing.

45.7MP Stacked BSI CMOS Sensor

The Nikon Z9 is powered by a newly built FX-format 45.7MP BSI stacked CMOS sensor. Its stacked construction provides quick readout rates and aids in rolling shutter reduction, while the BSI design adds to remarkable clarity and low noise when working at higher sensitivities. It also has a high-resolution chip (45.7MP) that helps landscape, portraiture, and other detail-oriented genres, as well as the ability to capture video at resolutions up to 8K. The full-frame BSI design is also noted for excellent color and detail reproduction, and this sensor has a native ISO range of 64-25600 that can be increased to ISO 32-102400.

Electronic Shutter-Only Design

The Nikon Z9 totally foregoes a mechanical shutter in favor of an electronic shutter for all capture modes, relying on the sensor's speed and stacking construction. The sensor's speed allows for up to 1/32,000 sec recording, and the layered construction eliminates motion distortion enabling realistic portrayal of fast-moving things such as golf clubs, baseball bats, and vehicles. In addition, despite the lack of a mechanical shutter, flash sync up to 1/200 sec. is available, as are high speed sync features.

493-Point Phase-Detection AF

The Nikon Z9 employs a 493-point phase-detection AF system that covers the whole sensor area to achieve fast and accurate focusing performance. This system benefits from the Z interface's high-speed transmission as well as the sensor's speed, which allows AF measurements to occur at up to 120 fps. This focusing technology also works in low-light circumstances, with a Starlight mode that allows focusing down to -8.5 EV, which is ideal for astrophotography, concert photography, and other nighttime shooting applications.

Subject Detection with Deep Learning Technology

The 3D Tracking option makes its debut in a Nikon mirrorless camera with the Nikon Z9. This popular Nikon DSLR focusing setting works in tandem with subject recognition to latch on to rapid, erratic moving subjects that move parallel and perpendicular to the camera. There are also three Dynamic-Area AF settings with varying focus area widths for capturing a wide range of moving subject types. Firmware 2.0 now includes 20 different types of custom Wide-Area AF selection patterns, 12 of which are supported during video recording, providing more precise AF and subject identification inside a specific area of the frame.

Up to 8K Recording Supported

In addition to its high-end photo capabilities, the Nikon Z9 is Nikon's most competent video camera, with a range of resolutions and frame rates available up to 8K. UHD 8K 30p video may be recorded using full pixel readout, with continuous filming feasible for around 2 hours and 5 minutes. Full-frame 4K recording at up to 120p for slow-motion replay is also supported. Oversampled UHD 4K recording at up to 60p is possible with an 8K area for greater sharpness and detail. In addition, high-resolution frame grabs from 8K and 4K movies may be captured in camera for 33MP or 11MP stills, respectively.

ProRes and H.265 10-Bit Internal Recording

Internal recording in ProRes 422 HQ and H.265 codecs is possible with 10-bit color and 4:2:2 sampling, while H.264 and 4:2:0 color can be utilized depending on workflow demands. There is also a 10-bit N-Log option and a Flat color profile for extra flexibility when color grading in post. Furthermore, HLG (Hybrid Log Gamma) may be utilized to create HDR-ready material directly from the camera.

Four-Axis Tilting LCD

The Nikon Z9 has a 3.2" 2.1m-dot four-axis tilting touchscreen LCD, a first for Nikon, which improves working from high and low angles while shooting in horizontal or vertical mode. The four-way tilting architecture of this screen enables for better viewing from a range of angles, and the user interface orientation will also change based on how the camera is handled.

Tough, Durable Construction

Dual CFexpress Type B memory card slots provide flexible file storing while also promoting high-speed reading and writing to keep up with the quick continuous shooting and high-resolution 8K video recording. Both slots are also XQD memory card compatible. Sony Alpha 1 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Sony Alpha 1 is a genuine flagship camera because it is one camera that can do everything. This full-frame mirrorless camera was built without cutting corners and offers high-resolution still photography, stunning 8K video recording, speed and sensitivity, and connection for the most demanding professional workflows. The α1 offers high resolution and unprecedented speed combined with sensitivity and dynamic range that can bring the creator's vision to life.

50.1MP Full-Frame BSI CMOS Sensor and BIONZ XR

The Sony Alpha 1 has a full-frame stacked back-illuminated CMOS Exmor RSTM sensor with integrated memory and 50.1 effective megapixels. This not only produces excellent image quality but also enables the 1 to shoot continuously at up to 30 frames per second while providing quick, accurate phase-detection AF and the first full-frame 8.6K oversampled 8K movies in the series. Outstanding performance for a brand-new era of image creation. has a new system design and significantly better processing speed for all phases of signal processing, starting with image acquisition. For exceptional image quality, processing latency is reduced while image processing capability is considerably improved. Regardless of the real-time processing load, quick, stress-free control response is maintained thanks to distributed processing for user interface, network, and file management.

Continuous shooting at up to 30fps

The Sony a1 with an electronic shutter can shoot up to 165 full-frame JPEG images4 or 155 full-frame compressed RAW images5 at up to 30 frames per second3 while maintaining full AF and AE tracking performance thanks to a fast readout from the 50.1-megapixel image sensor and a sizable buffer memory. When timing is crucial for sports and other dynamic subjects, this can be a tremendous confidence booster.

Silent, vibration-free electronic shutter

When filming sports or events in a calm atmosphere, the electronic shutter makes no mechanical noise. A second factor in the higher image quality is the electronic shutter's lack of vibration, which reduces the possibility of vibration-induced blur. Furthermore, compared to its mechanical counterpart, the electronic shutter is far more durable because it contains no moving parts.

High resolution and sensitivity with 15-stop dynamic range

The  Alpha 1's 50.1 effective megapixel image sensor produces remarkable resolution because to highly effective noise-reduction technology. In addition to high sensitivity with minimal noise and roughly 15 stops12 of dynamic range at lower sensitivity levels for smooth, natural gradations from shadows to highlights, the resolution is further enhanced by these features.

Wide sensitivity range

The new BIONZ XR image processing engine of Sony a1 works with this sensor's high pixel count, together with its back-illuminated structure, gapless on-chip lenses, AR-coated seal glass, and other unique imaging technologies, to produce great resolution and low noise over a broad sensitivity range: Standard ISO 100-32000, extendable to ISO 50-102400.

5-axis optical in-body image stabilization

The Sony Alpha 1's 50.1-megapixel sensor produces high-resolution photographs with the highest possible quality thanks to a high-precision stabilization unit, gyro sensors, and enhanced image stabilization algorithms. This results in a shutter speed advantage of up to 5.5 steps. The Active Mode on the 1 also provides excellent stabilization for handheld movie filming.

759 point full-area phase-detection AF

A high-density focal plane phase-detection AF system with 759 phase-detection points covers almost 92% of the image area, ensuring accuracy and unwavering focus in situations when focusing could otherwise be challenging. Together with a 425-point contrast AF system, the 759-point focal plane phase-detection AF system ensures accurate AF performance in any situation.

8K 30p and 4K 120p Support

Sony Alpha 1 Mirrorless Digital Camera comes with a high-resolution sensor and quick processing capability, UHD 8K 30p XAVC HS 10-bit 4:2:2 video recording is feasible using the full width of the sensor, providing 8.6K oversampling for excellent sharpness and realism. Low-bit-rate proxy files with HD resolution can be simultaneously recorded for playback more quickly in order to facilitate the management of this high-resolution recording mode. Additionally, 8K video can be broadcast over HDMI in 8-bit 4:2:0 format at 400 Mb/s and 200 Mb/s, respectively, in the V90 and V60 ratings of UHS-II SD cards.

Built-in Wi-Fi supports 2 x 2 MIMO

The built-in wireless LAN supports communication on the 2.4-GHz and 5-GHz bands, with the latter supporting 2x2 MIMO (IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac) for industry-leading speed. Even with the camera's sturdy magnesium alloy casing, dual antennas provide dependable connectivity. For news and sports reporters who must deliver with dependably quick turnaround times, 5-GHz connectivity can be a significant advantage.

Comprehensive touch operation

The Sony Alpha 1 Mirrorless Digital Camera's menu has been reorganized to make it easier to navigate, and touch-sensitive menu operation gives quicker, more intuitive control. Each and every primary menu and function menu is touch responsive. The controls are made even more simple to use with Touch Focus and Touch Tracking. When Touch Tracking is enabled, all you need to do to start Real-time Tracking for a subject in stills and movies is touch it on the monitor.

Improved dust- and moisture-resistant design

Sealing is provided at all body seams and the battery cover of Sony Alpha 1 Mirrorless Digital Camera. The media slots have a double sliding cover and lock that keep water out. A lens lock button and mount cushion help too.

full_description:
FUJIFILM X-E4 Mirrorless Camera with 27mm Lens Silver

The silver FUJIFILM X-E4 is a rangefinder-styled mirrorless camera with a well-rounded mix of stills and video capabilities. The X-E4 features the same 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 APS-C sensor and X-Processor 4 as the flagship model, and it boasts rich color reproduction, a broad dynamic range, and an exceptional sensitivity range for working in low-light circumstances. In terms of speed, DCI/UHD 4K as well as slow-motion Full HD recording are available, and rapid continuous shooting at up to 8 fps is allowed for stills. In addition, the sensor's architecture has a hybrid autofocus technology, which combines 425 phase-detection points with a contrast-detection system for fast and precise AF performance.

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor

The APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor of FUJIFILM X-E4, which boasts a back-illuminated design for smooth tonal reproduction, increased low-light performance, and a wide native sensitivity range of ISO 160-12800, is at the heart of the X-E4. It, too, is an X-Trans sensor with a randomized pixel array, which gives a high level of picture clarity and sharpness due to the absence of an optical low-pass filter. In comparison to traditional pixel patterns, the X-Trans design more closely resembles the organic nature of film to provide subtle colors and tonal transitions while also eliminating moiré and aliasing.

X-Processor 4

This AF technology of FUJIFILM X-E4 provides faster, more accurate focusing in a wide range of illumination settings down to -7 EV. An updated X-Processor 4 with a quad-core CPU complements the imaging and focusing capabilities, delivering faster, more responsive performance throughout the camera system, including a full-resolution 8 fps shooting rate with the mechanical shutter, a 20 fps rate with an electronic shutter, or a 30 fps rate with an electronic shutter and a 1.25x crop.

UHD and DCI 4K Video Recording

Beyond stills, the X-E4 has a diverse range of video capabilities, including internal DCI/UHD 4K recording at up to 30 fps and Full HD recording at up to 240 fps for super slow-motion playback. The X-Processor 4's speed improves overall video performance by enabling rapid read rates while recording video and reducing rolling shutter distortion when capturing moving subjects. A micro-HDMI connector also allows for 10-bit 4:2:2 recording to an external recorder.

Body Design

The 0.62x magnification of the bright, high-resolution 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder ensures clear and comfortable eye-level viewing. The touchscreen design of the tilting 3.0" 1.62m-dot LCD of FUJIFILM X-E4 allows for straightforward operation and playback, and the 180° upward tilting design greatly favors working from high and front-facing shooting angles. The top plate features a number of physical controls for quick, simple exposure tuning, including separate shutter speed and exposure compensation knobs that allow direct modification even when the camera is turned off. This exposure compensation dial also features a C position for a +/- 5 EV range when used in conjunction with the command dials. The rear joystick may be used for easy AF point selection and switching, menu navigation, and image playback.

XF 27mm f/2.8 R WR Lens

The very small pancake prime XF 27mm f/2.8 R WR lens of FUJIFILM X-E4 is included with the camera body. This 41mm-equivalent lens has been upgraded with a weather-sealed construction and a manual aperture ring for easy exposure control adjustment. In terms of optics, one aspherical element is used to decrease distortion and spherical aberrations, while a Super EBC coating is used to suppress flare and ghosting. A high-torque DC coreless motor is also employed to achieve rapid, precise, and near-silent focusing capability, which benefits both picture and video applications.

FUJIFILM X-T4 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The FUJIFILM X-T4 is a versatile mirrorless camera that combines sophisticated stills and video capabilities, as well as expanded workflow and assistive features, to meet the demands of multimedia image-makers. The sensor's BSI design reduces noise and improves overall clarity, and it is combined with the X-Processor 4 for quick performance and responsiveness. The sensor's architecture also allows for a hybrid autofocus system, which combines 425 phase-detection points with a contrast-detection system to provide fast and precise AF performance. In addition, the X-T4 includes a 6.5 stop-effective sensor-shift image stabilization technology to lessen the appearance of camera shake with practically any attached lens.

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor and X-Processor 4

The APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor, which boasts a back-illuminated design for smooth tonal reproduction, increased low-light performance, and a broad native sensitivity range of ISO 160-12800, is at the heart of the X-T4. It, too, is an X-Trans sensor with a randomized pixel array, which gives a high level of picture clarity and sharpness due to the absence of an optical low-pass filter. In comparison to traditional pixel patterns, the X-Trans design more closely resembles the organic nature of film to provide subtle colors and tonal transitions while eliminating moiré and aliasing.

In-Body Image Stabilization

The FUJIFILM X-T4 Mirrorless Digital Camera's built-in 5-axis sensor-shift image stabilization reduces the appearance of camera shaking by up to 6.5 stops. This technology works with most X Series lenses, including non-stabilized ones, and benefits working with slower shutter speeds and shooting in low-light circumstances. Additionally, 4-axis digital image stabilization may be employed during video recording to help stabilize footage, especially while filming handheld.

UHD and DCI 4K Video Recording

Beyond stills, the X-T4 has a diverse range of video capabilities, including internal DCI/UHD 4K recording at up to 60 fps and Full HD recording at up to 240 fps for super slow-motion playback. The X-Processor 4's speed improves overall video performance by enabling rapid read rates while recording video and reducing rolling shutter distortion when capturing moving subjects. A micro-HDMI connector also allows for 10-bit 4:2:2 recording to an external recorder. The X-T4 has the F-Log gamma setting, which produces a flat image for use in advanced color grading applications during editing, in addition to the supporting 10-bit color depth. This increases the possible dynamic range in tough circumstances, and picture modifications to highlight tone, shadow tone, color, and sharpness may also be done.

Body Design

The FUJIFILM X-T4 Mirrorless Digital Camera's bright, high-resolution 3.69m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder features a 0.75x magnification and the EVF's refresh rate can be increased to 100 fps to eliminate latency for smoother panning and tracking motions. The rear joystick may be used for easy AF point selection and switching, menu navigation, and image playback. The mechanical shutter has been rebuilt and is rated for 300,000 actuation.

Movie Mode

Every component of the X-T4 has been engineered to accommodate the hybrid photographer, including a separate STILL/MOVIE lever that allows for smooth transitions between photography and videography. full_description:
FUJIFILM X-H2S Mirrorless Camera(Only Body)

The FUJIFILM X-H2S camera is a multimedia mirrorless camera with powerful picture and video capabilities, including a newly enhanced X-Trans stacked sensor, refined AF and subject identification, and stunning 6.2K video recording. This camera, which tops the X System, combines the intuitiveness, design, and image quality that FUJIFILM is recognized for with a new, quick approach to video and continuous shooting applications.

X-Trans 5 Stacked BSI Sensor

The X-H2S is the first X Series camera to utilize a stacked sensor, with an APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans 5 stacked BSI sensor that enhances readout rates and low-light performance over prior generations. First, as an X-Trans sensor, it employs a unique color filter array that reduces moiré and contributes to more natural color rendering; second, the BSI design reduces noise and improves tonality and clarity; and, finally, the stacked design greatly reduces rolling shutter and other motion distortion to better suit high-speed video and photo photo applications.

X-Processor 5

In addition to the newly built sensor, the X-Processor 5 features 64-bit processing of X-H2S to provide 3x quicker rates for both video and picture activities than the X-T4. On the video side, this permits recording at up to 6.2K with high bitrates, such as ProRes 422 HQ, or at high speeds, such as 240 fps Full HD recording. On the stills side, quicker processing implies faster shooting to accommodate capturing moving subjects. Shooting at up to 40 frames per second is possible when using an electronic shutter, with a buffer of 140 consecutive uncompressed raw frames. Shooting speeds of up to 15 frames per second are feasible with the mechanical shutter, as is the capacity to shoot up to 1000 raw shots in a single burst.

4K 120p and 6.2K 30p Internal Recording

The X-H2S features a well-rounded recording mechanism that positions this camera solidly in the 'hybrid' category and works equally well for video as it does for photo. Internal 4:2:2 10-bit recording in DCI/UHD 4K at up to 120p and Full HD at up to 240p, as well as an open-gate 3:2 6.2K option appropriate for anamorphic applications, is possible. H.265 and three ProRes tiers are also supported, including the high bandwidth 422 HQ, the normal 422, and the more compressed 422 LT. At all frame rates and resolutions, continuous recording lengths of up to 90 minutes are feasible.

External Raw Recording

When linked X-H2S with a suitable external recorder, raw video recording via the full-size HDMI connector is available. Both ProRes RAW and Blackmagic RAW recording are supported, as well as working with F-Log or F-Log 2 profiles and working at resolutions up to the open-gate 6.2K.

Hybrid AF with Deep Learning AI

Autofocus performance is substantially quicker and more intelligent as a result of the increased processing. This hybrid focusing technology employs 425 phase-detection points and is now sensitive down to -7 EV, allowing it to function in really low-light circumstances. Furthermore, an AI adaptable algorithm powered by deep learning implies that this focusing system is better adapted to automatically recognize and track a range of subject categories. facial and Eye Detection capabilities of the X-H2S have been enhanced in comparison to prior focusing systems for higher accuracy and to account for distinctive characteristics such as spectacles, facial coverings, and hairlines. In addition, the list of authorized topic types has been enlarged to include automobiles, planes, trains, motorcycles, birds, horses, dogs, cats, and other animals.

In-Body Image Stabilization

The X-H2S camera's built-in 5-axis sensor-shift image stabilization reduces the appearance of camera shake by up to 7 stops. This technology works with most X Series lenses, including non-stabilized ones, and is useful for shooting at slower shutter speeds or in low-light situations. Additionally, digital image stabilization can be employed during video recording to help stabilize footage, particularly while shooting handheld.

Practical and Durable Design

Bright, clear, and detailed eye-level viewing is made possible by the large OLED electronic viewfinder's 0.8x magnification and sharp 5.76m-dot resolution. The X-H2S camera of rear 3.0"LCD is equipped with the highest 1.62 mdot resolution for intuitive control, and also has a touchscreen interface. Moreover, it features a multidirectional design that allows the display to be tilted on either side, raised or downwards and closed with an integrated screen facing the body for protection. An easy way to quickly review the shooting settings is by using a 1.28" black and white LCD panel on the top plate.

Flexible Connectivity

Full-size HDMI Type A connector for video output to a display or recorder outside the house. The X-H2S camera has Type-C USB 3.2 Gen 2 port allows data transfer, tethering, and in-camera battery charging. For more control over audio recording, there are external microphone and 3.5mm headphone ports available. Flash sync via the PC sync port. For use with wired remote controllers, use the 2.5mm remote port. 26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor and X-Processor 5

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor and X-Processor 4

The APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor in the FUJIFILM X-T30 II has a back-illuminated design for better low-light performance, smooth tonal reproduction, and a low native ISO 160 setting. Because it is an X-Trans sensor, it also uses a randomized pixel array, which eliminates the need for an optical low-pass filter and results in very crisp and high-quality images. This AF technology of FUJIFILM X-T30 II offers low-light sensitivity down to EV -7 and quicker, more accurate focusing performance. In addition to using four CPU units for speedier picture processing, the X-Processor 4 also improves overall performance by having faster tracking and autofocus.

UHD and DCI 4K Video Recording

An alluring variety of video features is available with the X-T30, including internal UHD 4K30 video recording at up to 200 Mb/s, which allows for simultaneous external and internal recording. The FUJIFILM X-T30 II is also able to record in DCI 4K30 and Full HD 1080p120. Video files may be stored in 4K using MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 or HEVC/H.265 compressions. Fast read rates during 4K video recording are made possible by the quad-CPU X-Processor 4's speed, which significantly improves overall video performance and lessens rolling shutter distortion while capturing moving objects. The F-Log gamma option, which produces a flat image for use with sophisticated color grading software during editing, is another feature of the FUJIFILM X-T30 II.

Enhanced Autofocus

The X-T30 II has X-Processor 4 quad-core CPU employs Intelligent Hybrid AF to provide quick, precise focus on any subject in as little as 0.02 seconds, but major improvements have been made to follow moving subjects, maximizing focusing for both still images and its potent 4K/30p video capabilities. The original model's low light focusing capability has been increased to -7EV. Strong face and eye detection AF, along with a new Face Selection option, are provided by 425 sensors, which offer 100% phase detect AF across the frame.

18 Film Simulation and Grain Effect Modes

The FUJIFILM X-Pro3 is a unique mirrorless camera that stands out for its unusual viewfinder design, concealed LCD screen, and sleek, black finish design that draws inspiration from rangefinders. An ISO 160–12800 sensitivity range is also made possible by the sensor and CPU, allowing for operation in a range of illumination scenarios. The X-Pro3's advanced design, which incorporates the Hybrid Multi Viewfinder, which combines an optical and an electronic 3.69 million dot OLED viewfinder, is one of its strongest points. With the dedicated lever on the front of the camera, you can quickly switch between these two viewing choices, giving you the ability to select between the accuracy and variety of an EVF and the ease of use and speed of an OVF. A revised back LCD design with a covert 180° tilting touchscreen with 1.62m-dot resolution is also present in the FUJIFILM X-Pro3. When not in use, the bigger 3.0" screen is kept concealed behind the body thanks to the innovative fold-down screen design, and a smaller settings display is accessible while shooting.

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor and X-Processor 4

The X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor, which has a back-illuminated design to provide smooth tonal reproduction, enhanced low-light performance, and a low native ISO 160 setting, is an APS-C-format 26.1MP sensor used in the X-Pro3. Because it is an X-Trans sensor, it also uses a randomized pixel array, which eliminates the need for an optical low-pass filter and results in very crisp and high-quality images. The X-Trans design more closely resembles the organic nature of film than traditional pixel patterns, which helps to reduce moiré and aliasing and provide subtle hues and tonal shifts. An extended phase-detection autofocus system with 425 customizable points that covers almost the whole sensor surface is also a feature of the sensor's design.

Hybrid Multi Viewfinder

A crisp, realistic picture of the scene is provided by the optical viewfinder, making subject tracking and composition simpler. The improved design includes an Electronic Rangefinder feature that functions similarly to a mechanical rangefinder while also superimposing data from the electronic viewfinder over the optical viewfinder to provide manual focus adjustment that is more comparable. The electronic viewfinder of FUJIFILM X-Pro3 has a rapid playback speed of 100 frames per second (fps) and a high 3.69 million dot resolution to minimize latency and provide better tracking and panning motions. In addition to having a display that can be customized to change the type and quantity of information displayed in the viewfinder, the EVF allows you to evaluate exposure settings before shooting.

UHD and DCI 4K Video Recording

The X-Pro3 is more than just a stills camera; it has an alluring variety of video features, such as internal DCI/UHD 4K recording at up to 30 frames per second. The speed of the X-Processor 4 significantly improves overall video performance by allowing high read rates in 4K footage and assisting in the reduction of rolling shutter distortion while capturing moving objects. A 2.5mm external microphone port is also included on the camera for more sophisticated audio options.

Film Simulation and Grain Effect Modes

Utilizing FUJIFILM's extensive background in conventional film-based photography, the X-Pro3 has many Film Simulation modes. These modes imitate the appearance and feel of some of FUJIFILM's classic film types: Classic Chrome, which is intended to produce muted tones and a deep color reproduction, akin to that of an antiquated slide film; Acros, which offers smooth tones, deep blacks, and fine detail; and Eterna, which replicates the look of cinematic film with subdued colors and richer shadow tones. FUJIFILM X-H2 Mirrorless Camera With 16-80mm Lens

The FUJIFILM X-H2 is a high-resolution mirrorless crop-sensor camera with a breakthrough 40MP BSI sensor and an array of cutting-edge capabilities packed into a tiny and robust X-series chassis that pushes the frontiers of APS-C image. This high-performing camera, which sits atop the X-System lineup, inherits many of the GFX system's advances in digital capture technology to provide image quality, detail, and color rendition never before seen in a crop-sensor camera, while retaining the compact form factor and sleek design that have earned the X-System a loyal following worldwide.

X-Trans 5 BSI Sensor

The FUJIFILM X-H2 is ideal for architecture, travel, and landscape photographers, and it features a backside-illuminated, APS-C-format 40MP X-Trans 5 HR sensor, which increases resolution and improves low-light performance over prior generations. First, as an X-Trans sensor, it employs a unique color filter array that reduces moiré and contributes to more natural color rendering; second, the BSI design reduces noise and improves tonality and clarity; and, finally, the design greatly reduces rolling shutter and other motion distortion to better suit high-speed video and photo applications.

X-Processor 5

The newly built sensor of FUJIFILM X-H2, the X-Processor 5 features 64-bit processing to provide 3x quicker rates for both video and picture activities than the X-T4. This permits video recording at bit rates of up to 720 mb/s. On the stills side, quicker processing implies faster shooting to accommodate capturing moving subjects. Shooting at up to 20 frames per second is possible when using an electronic shutter, with a buffer of 202 consecutive uncompressed raw frames. Shooting speeds of up to 15 frames per second are feasible with the mechanical shutter, as is the capacity to shoot up to 1000 raw shots in a single burst.

External Raw Recording

When linked FUJIFILM X-H2 with a suitable external recorder, 12-bit raw video recording is allowed via the full-size HDMI connector. Both ProRes RAW and Blackmagic RAW recording are supported, as well as F-Log or F-Log 2 profiles and resolutions up to open-gate 8K.

Pixel Shift Multishot

With the aid of the Pixel Shift Combiner software, Pixel Shift Multishot makes numerous exposures in quick succession, each one accurately moving the image sensor by half a pixel, catching the subject on a different region of the image sensor each time and providing a single 160-Megapixel image by the FUJIFILM X-H2.

In-Body Image Stabilization

The FUJIFILM X-H2 camera has built-in 5-axis sensor-shift image stabilization which reduces the appearance of camera shaking by up to 7 stops. This technology works with most X Series lenses, including non-stabilized ones, and is useful for shooting at slower shutter speeds or in low-light situations. Additionally, digital image stabilization can be employed during video recording to help stabilize footage, particularly while shooting handheld.

Hybrid AF with Deep Learning AI

Autofocus performance is substantially quicker and more intelligent as a result of the increased processing. This hybrid focusing technology of FUJIFILM X-H2 employs 425 phase-detection points and is now sensitive down to -7 EV, allowing it to function in really low-light circumstances. Furthermore, an AI adaptable algorithm powered by deep learning implies that this focusing system is better adapted to automatically recognize and track a range of subject categories.

Practical and Durable Design

For bright, clear, and detailed eye-level viewing with FUJIFILM X-H2, the large OLED electronic viewfinder has a sharp 5.76m-dot resolution and a 0.8x magnification. The rear 3.0" LCD display boasts a high 1.62m-dot resolution and a touchscreen interface for easy control. Furthermore, the screen's vari-angle construction allows it to be flipped out to the side, angled up or down, and closed with the screen against the body for protection. The 1.28" monochrome LCD screen on the top plate provides a quick way to examine shooting settings. For file-saving versatility, there are two memory card slots: one CFexpress Type B slot and one SD UHS-II slot. The CFexpress Type B slot should be prioritized for higher bitrate video recording and quick continuous shooting, while the SD slot can be used for backups or less time-critical shooting.

Flexible Connectivity

Full-size HDMI Type A output port for connecting to an external recorder or monitor. Tethering, data transfer, and in-camera battery charging are all supported by the USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C connection. For more control over audio recording, there are 3.5mm headphone and external microphone connectors of FUJIFILM X-H2. PC sync port for flash synchronization. For use with wired remote controllers, a 2.5mm remote port is included. The camera's integrated Bluetooth and Wi-Fi networking enables wireless image sharing to a mobile device as well as remote control via the device.

FUJIFILM XF 16-80mm f/4 R OIS WR Lens

The FUJIFILM XF 16-80mm f/4 R OIS WR is a flexible 24-120mm-equivalent zoom lens of FUJIFILM X-H2 with a continuous f/4 maximum aperture that is well-suited for a wide range of shooting settings. This adaptable architecture is complemented with an innovative optical arrangement that contains three aspherical elements and one ED aspherical element to assist decrease aberrations and deliver outstanding sharpness and clarity. When working in bright light, a Super EBC coating increases contrast and color neutrality by decreasing flare and ghosting. A rapid and silent autofocus mechanism, as well as a six-stop image stabilization technology that eliminates the impression of camera shake, are very useful in a range of circumstances.

Sony Alpha A9 III Full Frame Mirrorless Camera (Only Body)

The Sony Alpha a9 III is a fast and extremely powerful device for sports, wildlife, photojournalism, and much more. This breakthrough sensor technology sets the bar for full-frame image, allowing you to shoot raw continuously at up to 120 fps and use flash sync up to 1/80,000 second. Combining the capability of this 24.6MP sensor with Sony's strong BIONZ XR engine and AI Processing Unit creates a system that will give unrivaled performance for those seeking a highly responsive and dependable camera system.

The First Global Shutter

Sony introduced the Alpha a9 III, the world's first full-frame global shutter mirrorless camera. The usage of a global shutter outperforms rolling shutter technology, which has been employed for decades. A global shutter allows for a nearly immediate and simultaneous reading of all 24.6MP, avoiding skew and other distortions that plagued rolling shutters. It also outperforms mechanical shutter technology in every manner, rendering the physical shutter obsolete with the Alpha a9 III.

Pre-Capture and Speed Boost

The Alpha a9 III may be set to start recording photos to the buffer while the shutter button is half pushed. Users can change this anywhere from 0.05 to 1.0 second. When you push the shutter, these photographs will be recorded on the memory card. Not every shoot necessitates the Alpha a9 III has amazing top speed of 120 fps. With Speed Boost and the C5 button, which is conveniently located near the grip on the front of the camera, users may rapidly convert their camera's continuous shooting frame rate to a quicker one to ensure their next photo is perfect. Photographers will be able to choose frame rates of up to 120 fps.

Enhanced Functionality and Usability

A voice memo function offers crisper recordings with a microphone placed near to the user. These notes may be transmitted via FTP and converted to text with Sony's Transfer & Tagging tool. IPTC metadata may be automatically applied to photos, and up to 20 presets can be stored. Image bursts may now be shown as a group during playback, making it easier to traverse through a shoot, particularly when using the Alpha a9 III's fastest continuous shooting rates. During filming, the built-in Wi-Fi and Ethernet may be utilized to transport data quickly across the network.

The Canon EOS R10 is a compact mirrorless camera with a hybrid ethos that emphasizes mobility without compromising capabilities. The R10 introduces an APS-C sensor to the R system, as well as high-speed shooting, clever AF, and excellent 4K video recording to support a multimedia workflow.

APS-C Comes to EOS R

The Canon EOS R10 has a 24.2MP APS-C CMOS sensor, which lies in a resolution sweet spot and provides an excellent balance of resolution, file size, speed, and low-light performance. This sensor is suitable for both regular photography and UHD 4K recording since the file sizes are tiny enough to allow both fast continuous burst shooting and long video recording.

DIGIC X Processor

The Canon EOS R10 uses a DIGIC X image processor from the R3 to perform a number of high-speed operations including as continuous shooting and high-resolution video recording. The R10 can shoot at up to 23 frames per second with a silent electronic shutter or 15 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, providing AF and AE readings before each shot. The CPU also adds to a wide ISO 100-32000 sensitivity range, which is expandable up to ISO 51200 for working in low-light conditions.

UHD 4K Video Recording

Aside from still photography, the Canon EOS R10 features high-resolution UHD 4K 8-bit recording at up to 60p using a reduced section of the sensor or at 30p using an oversampled 6K recording area for better clarity, moiré reduction, and noise reduction. Furthermore, 120p recording at up to Full HD resolution is supported for slow-motion playback.

Dual Pixel CMOS AF II

The advanced Dual Pixel CMOS AF II technology, which was carried over from the EOS R3, features 651 automatic AF points that cover the whole sensor area for faster, more responsive, and more precise focusing performance. This phase-detection focusing technology also offers better subject recognition and tracking capabilities, with the ability to intelligently discern between humans, animals, and vehicles, and tracking will automatically latch onto these objects and maintain tight focus during burst photos.

Intuitive Construction

A bright, sharp 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder is incorporated with the EOS R10 for high-resolution eye-level viewing. This 0.95x finder has fast processing with almost no latency, and a fast 120-fps refresh rate may be configured for vivid, realistic motion portrayal. There is also a 3.0" vari-angle LCD that lets you to operate at high, low, and front-facing angles. The adjustable posture is complemented with a touchscreen interface, and the superb 1.04m-dot resolution allows for vivid playback and live view monitoring.

Flexible Connectivity

There are both wired and wireless networking options, allowing for different means of transmitting photographs and movies as well as remotely managing the camera. Physically, the EOS R10 camera has a USB Type-C port, a micro-HDMI port, and a 3.5mm microphone port for video recording. Wireless options include 2.4GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth for data transfer and remote camera control.

Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens

The Canon RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM Lens of Canon EOS R10 promises a broad zoom range in a small design. It is designed exclusively for Canon's APS-C-format R Series mirrorless cameras and has a 29-72mm equivalent zoom range. FUJIFILM X-S10 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The FUJIFILM X-S10 Mirrorless Camera is a small, easy-to-use camera with high performance. The X-S10 combines renowned FUJIFILM design, engineering, and color science in a user-friendly compact. The newly designed body has a deep grip for ultimate security while shooting handheld shots, even with bigger lenses, and an intuitive, simple control dial for easy operation. It also has cutting-edge technology, such as five-axis in-body image stabilization for smooth movie and super-sharp stills, a 180° variable-angle LCD touchscreen that can cover even the most difficult angles, and speedy 0.02-second focusing with accuracy down to -6EV. When paired with the exceptional 26.1 megapixels, back-side illuminated X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor, and quad-core X-Processor 4 CPU, it can capture spectacular photos and cinema-quality video, while capturing the distinct beauty of Fujifilm's 18 Film Simulation modes.

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor and X-Processor 4

The APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor in the X-S10 sports a back-illuminated design for smooth tone and color reproduction, excellent low-light performance, and a broad native sensitivity range of ISO 160-12800. It, too, is an X-Trans sensor with a randomized pixel array, which gives a high level of picture clarity and sharpness due to the lack of an optical low-pass filter. In comparison to standard pixel patterns, the X-Trans design more closely replicates the organic nature of film to provide subtle colors and tonal transitions while also eliminating moiré and aliasing. The sensor also has an enhanced phase-detection focusing system with 425 customizable points that span virtually the full sensor surface. This AF technology provides faster, more accurate focusing in a wide range of illumination settings down to -6 EV. The X-Processor 4, with a quad-core CPU, complements the imaging and focusing capabilities by delivering faster, more responsive performance throughout the camera system, including a full-resolution 8 fps shooting rate with the mechanical shutter, a 20 fps rate with an electronic shutter, or a 30 fps rate with an electronic shutter and a 1.25x crop.

In-Body Image Stabilization

The camera's built-in 5-axis sensor-shift image stabilization reduces the appearance of camera shaking by up to 5 stops. This technology works with most X Series lenses, including non-stabilized ones, and is useful for shooting at slower shutter speeds or in low-light situations. Furthermore, 4-axis digital image stabilization may be enabled during video recording to help stabilize footage, especially while filming handheld.

DCI and UHD 4K Video Recording

In addition to still images, the FUJIFILM X-S10 Mirrorless Digital Camera has a wide range of video capabilities, including internal DCI/UHD 4K recording at up to 30 frames per second and Full HD recording at up to 240 frames per second for extreme slow-motion playback. The X-Processor 4's speed improves overall video performance by enabling rapid read rates while recording video and reducing rolling shutter distortion when capturing moving subjects. In addition, a micro-HDMI connector allows for 10-bit 4:2:2 recording to an optional external recorder for increased quality, and the camera includes a 3.5mm microphone jack for advanced audio recording.

Body Design

The FUJIFILM X-S10 Mirrorless Camera boasts a high-resolution 2.36m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder with a 0.62x magnification for bright and clear eye-level viewing. The Vari-angle 3.0" 1.04m-dot LCD boasts a touchscreen interface for straightforward control and playback, and the articulating design greatly improves working from high and low shooting angles. This variable-angle design also allows you to shut the screen against the camera body, hiding it from view for distraction-free shooting. This Digital Mirrorless Camera Despite the small size, a big righthand grip allows for robust and sturdy handling for all-day enjoyment. For quick, intuitive control over the camera and exposure settings, the top plate has a range of physical controls, including a dedicated exposure mode dial and two additional top dials. It incorporates a rear joystick for convenient AF point selection and switching, as well as menu navigation and image playback. Its integrated Bluetooth and Wi-Fi networking enables wireless image sharing to a mobile device as well as remote control of the camera. It also has For quick and versatile file storage, a single SD memory card slot supports up to the UHS-I standard.

full_description:
FUJIFILM X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The FUJIFILM X-T3 is a versatile mirrorless camera designed for videographers and action photographers alike, with high-speed performance, more-than-capable images, and multimedia versatility. High-resolution stills and 4K video may be recorded utilizing a newly designed image sensor and processor, while an adept autofocus system provides rapid and precise focusing performance. The sensor, a 26.1MP APS-C-format X-Trans CMOS 4, has a back-illuminated design to improve image quality across the sensitivity range, as well as a large 2.16m-point phase-detection autofocus system for rapid, precise AF performance and subject tracking. The X-Processor 4 complements the imaging and focusing by employing four CPUs for speedier picture processing, as well as continuous shooting at 11 frames per second with a mechanical shutter, 30 frames per second with a 1.25x crop and electronic shutter, and inbuilt 4K60p 10-bit video recording. The X-T3 keeps the classically inspired appearance and prominent tactile controls of previous X-T cameras but adds a revolutionary OLED electronic viewfinder design with a 3.69m-dot resolution and a high 0.75x magnification. This finder offers a high refresh rate of 100 fps for smooth viewing and does not have blackouts when filming at the maximum 30 fps rate. A special Sports Finder Mode may also be employed, which emphasizes the 16.6MP crop area to offer you more room outside of the frame to detect moving things. A rear 3.2" 1.04m-dot LCD monitor, on the other hand, may be utilized for live view shooting and bigger picture playback. The X-T3 also has built-in Bluetooth for wireless sharing and remote control, and the magnesium alloy shell is entirely weather-sealed for working in inclement weather.

26.1MP APS-C X-Trans BSI CMOS 4 Sensor with X-Processor 4

The X-T3 is built on a newly designed sensor, which is an APS-C-format 26.1MP X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor with a back-illuminated design for smooth tonal rendering, increased low-light performance, and a low native ISO 160 setting. It still uses the randomized pixel array as an X-Trans sensor, which delivers a high level of picture clarity and sharpness due to the lack of an optical low-pass filter. In comparison to traditional pixel patterns, the X-Trans design more closely resembles the organic nature of film to provide subtle colors and tonal transitions while eliminating moiré and aliasing. The sensor's architecture also contains an enlarged phase-detection autofocus system with 2,160,000 points that span virtually the whole sensor surface. This AF technology provides faster, more accurate focusing as well as low-light sensitivity down to EV -3. In addition to the imaging and focusing capabilities, an upgraded X-Processor 4 is included, which provides quicker focus response for subject tracking and also offers Face- and Eye-Detection AF when operating in AF-C mode and recording video. The X-Processor 4 also has four CPU units for speedier picture processing, which improves overall performance with AF rates as low as 0.06 sec. Shooting intervals of 0.17 seconds, shutter lag of 0.045 seconds, and a start-up time of 0.3 seconds. Continuous shooting at up to 11 frames per second with a mechanical shutter or 30 frames per second with an electronic shutter and a 1.25x crop is possible, and internal UHD 4K60 video recording with 10-bit output is also supported.

UHD and DCI 4K Video Recording

The X-T3 is more than just a stills camera; it also has a tempting variety of video capabilities, including internal UHD 4K60p video recording at 4:2:0 10-bit and 4K60p 4:2:2 10-bit through the HDMI output, both at up to 400 Mb/s—and simultaneous external and internal recording is possible. DCI 4K30 and Full HD 1080p120 recordings are also supported, and video files may be stored in MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 or HEVC/H.265 compression, as well as 4K. The quad-CPU X-Processor 4's speed greatly improves overall video performance by enabling quick read rates of 17 ms while recording 4K60 footage, which helps to decrease rolling shutter distortion when capturing moving objects. The X-T3 has the F-Log gamma setting, which produces a flat image for use in advanced color grading applications during editing, in addition to the supporting 10-bit color depth. This increases the possible dynamic range in tough circumstances, and picture modifications to highlight tone, shadow tone, color, and sharpness may also be done. Working in F-Log now includes an improved noise reduction algorithm as well as 4K inter-frame noise reduction, and the minimum sensitivity has been reduced to ISO 640 to accommodate working in a wider range of scene types.

Body Design

A 3.69m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder provides a high 0.75x magnification, rapid 100 fps refresh rate, broad viewing angle, and lockable diopter adjustment. The viewfinder is blackout-free while shooting at up to 30 frames per second, and a special Sports Finder Mode can also be used, which highlights a 16.6MP crop area of the sensor to allow you to see outside of the image frame. A rear 3.0" 1.04m-dot LCD touchscreen is offered in addition to the EVF for easy live view shooting, playback and review, settings modification, and menu navigation. The screen also includes a three-way tilting design to accommodate working from high and low angles while filming horizontally or vertically. Dual SD card slots provide a more versatile and dependable way of storing imagery, and both card slots are UHS-II compliant for rapid transfer speeds. The top plate features several locking dials and levers for quick, simple exposure control, including a shutter speed dial for direct shutter speed change. The shutter speed dial includes an ISO dial for validating the sensitivity setting without turning on the camera, and the exposure compensation dial allows you to pick +/- 3 EV in 1/3 increments, with a command dial position expanding the range to +/- 5 EV for even more flexibility.

Modes for Film Simulation and Grain Effect

The X-T3 incorporates multiple Film Simulation modes, leveraging Fujifilm's extensive experience with conventional film-based photography. These modes are designed to replicate the look and feel of some of Fujifilm's classic film types, such as Eterna, which mimics the look of cinematic film with understated colors and richer shadow tones; Acros, which offers smooth tones, deep blacks, and fine detail; and Classic Chrome, which is designed to diver muted tones and deep color reproduction, similar to that of dated slide film. Other effects are available for both monochrome and color photography. A Grain Effect setting, in addition to mimicking specific film types, is available to imitate the look of antique film images with an organic grainy appearance, which is notably visible when printing.

full_description:
Nikon Z7 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)

The Nikon Z7 Mirrorless Camera and the ground-breaking Z System represent the next step in Nikon's imaging development. With a short 16mm flange distance and a large diameter design, the Z Mount is a new feature of this high-resolution FX-format camera that enables Nikon to produce more advanced optics and compact cameras with greater power. With a native sensitivity range of ISO 64–25600 and a 45.7MP BSI CMOS sensor and an EXPEED 6 Image Processing Engine, the Z7 is one of the first models in the series and offers outstanding image quality and speed.

45.7MP FX-Format BSI CMOS Sensor and EXPEED 6 Processor

A 45.7MP BSI CMOS sensor is used in the Nikon Z7 for high-resolution shooting, impressive low-light quality, and fast readout speeds to benefit continuous shooting, movies, and time-lapse recording. When operating at high ISO values, up to a native ISO 25600, the back-illuminated sensor's architecture allows for substantially cleaner high-sensitivity output for reduced noise, as well as vibrant and smooth clarity at sensitivities as low as ISO 64. To maximize the sensor's clarity and resolution, the traditional optical low-pass filter was also removed from the design. The EXPEED 6 image processor, which gives the camera system a lot of speed and can shoot continuously at 9 frames per second in raw, benefits the sensor.

4K UHD Video Recording and 8K Time-Lapse

The Nikon Z7 is a more-than-capable multimedia camera, utilizing the sensor and processing characteristics for more than simply still pictures. UHD 4K (3840 x 2160) video recording is possible in 30p, 25p, or 24p frame rates using either the full-frame area or a DX crop region. Full HD 1080p video recording at up to 120p for slow motion playback is also available, and video files can be stored on internal memory cards or as an uncompressed file to an optional external recorder via HDMI out.

493-Point Phase-Detect AF System

The Nikon Z7 comes with an array of 493 phase-detect autofocus points located on the sensor cover 90% of the image area both vertically and horizontally. This allows fast and accurate focusing for both stills and video, and with a wide coverage area, subject tracking will work out to the frame's edges. For video, hybrid AF is available, which automatically switches between phase- and contrast-detect systems to provide smooth focus throughout shooting. Furthermore, the latest NIKKOR Z lenses are intended for silent operation.

Large 3.2" 2.1m-dot LCD screen and 3.6M-Dot Quad VGA Viewfinder

For bright, crisp, and vivid image playback and live view filming, a 3.2" 2.1m-dot LCD screen is provided. The screen is tilted to benefit from working from both high and low angles, and it is also a touchscreen for more intuitive operation, navigation, and setting control. The Nikon Z7 Mirrorless Digital Camera also has a 3.6m-dot electronic finder for comfortable eye-level viewing. It boasts a high magnification of 0.80x and employs NIKKOR optics to ensure a sharp, clear image. The finder also includes a Fluorine coating for easier cleaning.

Built-in SnapBridge connectivity

Nikon Z7 Full Frame Mirrorless Digital Camera comes with built-in SnapBridge connectivity for easy transfer of low-resolution imagery and remote shooting capabilities. BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) and Wi-Fi enable the connection between the camera and a smart device; additionally, the mobile device can remotely trigger the shutter and display a live view image from the camera to enable working from a distance.
